Title: Data Scientist
Description: The Opportunity  In an effort to better serve our 47 million registered hourly workers and over 450,000 employer locations, Snagajob is looking for a Data Scientist to collaborate with key business stakeholders throughout the organization and help fulfill our mission of helping people find their best fit job. The Data Science role at Snagajob includes a heavy emphasis on search, information retrieval, matching, and recommendation, as well as experimental design and measurement of data science impact in the customer-facing product. This role provides an excellent opportunity to make a direct impact in a customer facing product.  Our tech stack includes Python (pandas, numpy, sklearn, pytorch, flask), AWS (EC2/ECS, S3, EMR, Sagemaker), Elasticsearch, Mongo, CircleCi, Docker, Terraform, and other technologies. You might not have experience in every area but if you have a drive to learn and grow, we encourage you to apply.  This role may be based remotely or in our Arlington or Richmond, VA or Charleston, SC office.  What Snagajob Can Promise You  When you join the Snagajob Engineering team, you'll be working on a high-volume, high-traffic site that gets over 50 million visits a month! But that's just the start of it. You get to contribute more than just code: we have a highly collaborative environment, so you'll influence what we build and how we build it. Expand your skills with our weekly tech talks. Learn about, and experiment with, new technologies/ideas in our monthly hack days and chapter meetings. Engineering at Snagajob isn't just about keeping the lights on and the site running. It's a place for you to learn and grow in a supportive team environment.  What You'll Get To Do  Develop new data science models and pipelines that are highly available, scalable, and reliable Collaborate with data scientists, developers, and product managers to integrate and validate machine learning solutions end to end Partner with product teams to analyze key business problems Support and improve existing data science pipelines and systems in production  Test and implement algorithms in scalable, product-ready code Research and investigate academic and industrial machine learning, natural language processing and modeling techniques to apply to our specific business cases   What You'll Bring  Advanced degree in computer science or a closely related field, with a concentration in machine learning, or equivalent experience Experience in advanced analytics and Applied Machine Learning Experience building and deploying models using common machine learning frameworks such as scikit-learn, PyTorch Experience working with relational and/or NoSQL data stores Familiarity working in Linux-based systems and/or cloud computing resources Experience in knowledge graphs and/or recommendation systems  Ability to work with ambiguous problem definitions Ability to communicate technical knowledge to a business audience The ability to live by Snagajob's core values - solidarity, candor, unconvention, fire - by being an ally, speaking hard truths, questioning the status quo, and always doing whatever it takes to meet our mission of putting people in the right-fit positions so they can maximize their potential and live more fulfilling lives   Bonus Points  Experience with A/B testing and analysis of engagement with online marketplaces  Experience working with search and information retrieval systems such as SolR/Elasticsearch, as well as experience with information retrieval success metrics   At Snagajob, we celebrate our differences in an inclusive workplace designed to support the things that make us individuals. Snagajob is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage candidates from all different backgrounds and identities to apply. Each new hire gives us the opportunity to bring in a fresh new perspective to further diversify our company for the benefit of our employees, products and our community.  Why Snagajob  Snagajob offers a highly competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, a 401k plan, health and fitness incentives, PTO, paid community service time, and a casual fun work environment with an award-winning culture. What Snaggers love most is our commitment to work-life blend and the amazing leaders who are dedicated to helping their teams grow personally and professionally. Snagajob promotes a culture of community and support, so once a Snagger, always a Snagger. We pride ourselves on keeping it real and not being afraid to challenge the status quo.  About Snagajob  Snagajob, the country's largest and fastest-growing platform for hourly work, connects more than 47 million active job seekers with employment opportunities at 450,000 employer locations in the US and Canada. Snagajob's mission is to put people in the right fit positions so they can maximize their potential and live more fulfilling lives. Through Snagajob, workers gain the flexibility of working when and where they choose while employers are assured every shift stays filled. For more information, visit www.Snagajob.com or connect with us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Software, Internet

Title: Data Scientist
Description: As a Data Scientist at Noodle.ai, you will collaborate with our Enterprise Services team,Software Engineers, Designers, and industry-specific experts from our customers. You willvbuild a deep understanding of the business problems our customers are tackling and then develop, test, and deploy advanced machine learning algorithms. As we grow, you will also develop reusable IP to help us move faster, dive deeper, and work more efficiently by generalizing the algorithms, methodologies, and supporting infrastructure that you build. As one of the early hires to join the Noodle.ai team, you will have a significant impact on the future of Enterprise Artificial Intelligence. And conversely, translate business needs and user needs into language and concepts that other data scientists can understand and work with. Productionalizing machine learning code and interfacing with industry standardmsoftware systems Understand and manipulate unstructured data from different platforms. Demonstrate proficiency at real-world modeling problems/DS problems - getting to a result that demonstrably generate business value  Qualifications: Required:  Graduate degree in a relevant field (Computer Science, Operations Research, Statistics, Applied Math...) or Bachelors degree and 2-4 years applying advanced AI techniques to real-world problems  Good to have:   4 years of experience applying advanced AI techniques to real-world problems Experience tackling data science problems characterized as high-dimension, low sample size (i.e., lots of potentially predictive features and highly diverse but low quality or highly sparse data.) Knowledge & understanding of a functional area of focus (i.e. Experience applying advanced analytics to supply chain optimization, demand forecasting, and/or revenue management) Knowledge & understanding of an industry area of focus (i.e. retail, manufacturing,CPG, 3PL, travel...)  Skills and Competencies:   Experience with common analysis tools (SQL, R, and Python). Demonstrable familiarity with code and programming concepts. Knowledge of Spark and/or Hadoop Knowledge of machine learning areas and techniques - Supervised machine learning,Unsupervised machine learning, Time series, Natural language processing, Outlier detection, Computer vision, Recommendation engines, Survival analysis, Reinforcement learning, and Adversarial learning Knowledge of data visualization tools - ggplot, d3.js and Matplottlib, and Tableau Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development Focus on delivering value and building lasting relationships through collaboration in an open and respectful working style Passion for learning and a desire to grow

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Who You AreYou are a full-stack data scientist, an experienced quantitative thinker who wants to develop further as both a data scientist and an engineer. You are skilled at finding the precise mathematical kernels of real-world business challenges faced by leading international financial institutions. You want to apply your expertise in statistics and computer science using Quantifind’s state-of-the-art infrastructure to solve problems in Natural Language Processing such as Entity Linking, Text Classification, and Topic Modeling. You are excited to work at a fast growing company where you will have the chance to expand your scientific and engineering skills in new areas. You share Quantifind’s commitment to winning together, and are eager to see your coworkers build on the technical foundations you will be creating. You are passionate about maintaining the high scientific and engineering standards required to enable your peers. Above all, you are a curious and independent problem solver who is motivated to find a place where your skills can have real impact. Who We AreQuantifind helps some of the world’s biggest banks catch money laundering and fraud. Quantifind also works with government agencies to use the same platform to uncover criminal networks and combat election tampering. Unlike other players in this space, Quantifind delivers results as software-as-a-service (SaaS) with consumer-grade user experiences.  Quantifind is a data science technology company whose AI platform uncovers signals of risk across disparate and unstructured text sources. In financial crimes risk management, Quantifind’s solution uniquely combines internal financial institution data with public domain data to assess risk in the context of Know Your Customer (KYC), Customer Due Diligence (CDD), Fraud Risk Management, and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) processes. Today these compliance processes are burdened by ever-increasing regulatory responsibilities and an expectation of frictionless transactions. Legacy technologies demand increasingly more human resources as the operations expand: Quantifind’s solution offers a way to cut through the inefficiency and enhance effectiveness simultaneously.   To help you succeed, we provide a supportive environment that fosters collaboration between teams and team members, where learning and professional growth are considered a key part of your success, and of ours. We offer a flexible work environment with a family friendly work-life balance. What A Great Candidate Looks Like:MS or higher in the following areas: Statistics and MathematicsAt least 3-5 years of professional industry experience, in addition to your academic experienceStrong programming experience in two or more of the following: Scala / Java, R, PythonOutstanding quantitative analytical abilityAble to take less than precise business requirements and translate them into statistical problems which you enjoy solvingCan develop methods and algorithms from first principles where necessary as opposed to relying fully on packaged third party solutionsExcellent written and verbal communication skills, with prior experience explaining assumptions, conclusions and methodology to both internal and external customersIn-depth knowledge of Statistics / Probability / Machine Learning including core Statistical concepts such as hypothesis testing, estimation, and inference, and Machine Learning foundations such as bias/variance trade-off, regularization, dimension reduction, and model interpretationSupervised and unsupervised statistical techniques such as regression (linear / logistic / tree based ensembles), clusteringExperience with unstructured text data using NLP methods such as Named Entity Recognition, Topic Modeling, Large Scale Document Classification, Word Embeddings, and Text SimilarityBasic knowledge of data structures and algorithms with a focus on complexity and performance implicationsExperience with SQL The Opportunity We OfferQuantifind is seeking to fill a Full-Stack Data Scientist position in Washington, DC on our Data Science team. We work closely with the Product Management team and Platform engineers to anticipate company needs and quickly put state-of-the-art mathematical tools into the hands of end users. Members of the Data Science team translate real world problems into quantitative language, find or create algorithms to solve those problems, and implement them in code. Our team values a creative and empathetic approach to problem solving and strives to maintain rigorous scientific and engineering standards. We will give you the opportunity to work on the full data science pipeline, bringing solutions from basic research all the way to production. We are an equal opportunity employer. We pride ourselves on living our values. We are curious. We respect each other. We are proactively transparent. We relentlessly solve problems. We win together. Will you join us? Apply now!
Industries: Software, Internet, Servicios y tecnologías de la información

Title: Data scientist (h/f)
Location: Vertou, Pays de la Loire, France
Description: Le programme data du groupe Maisons du Monde a presque quatre ans déjà, et se compose d’une trentaine de personnes (data scientists, data analysts, data engineers, web analysts). Les cas d’usages à développer vont du marketing digital (CRM, acquisition trafic, personnalisation/recommandation) à la supply chain, avec une activité R&D sanctuarisée. L’infrastructure data, développée dans l’équipe, est basée sur Google Cloud Platform. Les résultats sont là : nous sommes mis en avant par les équipes Google quant à l’usage de leurs outils cloud ! Dans une ambiance jeune et dynamique, où le travail d’équipe est mis en valeur, nous recherchons un(e) Data Engineer confirmé pour travailler sur toutes les problématiques liées à la gestion du réseau (quels produits mettre dans quel magasin et pourquoi, algorithme de comparaison de performance produit, …) Vous participez activement à la vie de l’équipe en collaborant étroitement avec les data scientists, data engineers et data analysts. Les missions seront variées (structuration de la chaîne Big Data, Dashboarding, Analyse Ad Hoc, mise en production d’algorithme) et demandent une grande rigueur. Vos missions :Vous êtes impliqué(e) dans l’engagement de l’équipe au quotidien. Cela inclut l’avancement sur les sujets du périmètre supply mais aussi la contribution à la maintenance de l’infrastructure technique de l’équipe Data dans son ensemble :Vous mettez en place les nouveaux flux d’entrée et de sortie au sein de la plateforme data, et irez jusqu’à l’activation de la donnée. Cela implique la collecte de données brutes, leur structuration pour utilisation générale, leur croisement pour des application spécifiques, leur restitution via dashboard :Vous assurez le delivery, et êtes constamment en veille sur les nouvelles technos :En plus des tâches techniques, vous serez mené(e) à interagir avec les utilisateurs finaux des données / dashboards pour recueillir leurs besoins. Cela nécessite la progressive montée en compétence sur les enjeux du métier de la supply. Profil : De formation supérieure en école d’ingénieur/université (niveau Bac+5 ou plus), vous possédez au minimum une première expérience professionnelle dans un programme data. SAVOIR-FAIRE :Connaissance de SQL, Docker, Python, Git (plus ou moins développées selon le niveau d’expérience professionnelle) :Connaissance de gestion d’une chaine Big Data, de la récupération de la donnée jusqu’à son exploitation finale :Notions de dashboarding / visualisation de données :La connaissance du monde du retail et de la supply-chain est un plus. SAVOIR-ETRE :Flexibilité dans l’apprentissage de nouvelles technologies :A l’aise dans le travail en équipe :Capacité d’interagir avec des profils non techniques (ex. vulgarisation, bon relationnel) :Capacité d’organisation et attention aux détails et à la qualité du travail accompli. Environnement Technique :Google Cloud Platform :Big Query, SQL-like, AI platform :Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow :Git :Python :Qlik Sense :Et tout autre outil que vous jugerez pertinent ! Informations complémentaires :Engagement Diversité/Handicap : https://recrutement.maisonsdumonde.com/notre-ethique/diversite-handicap/Poste basé à Vertou

Title: Data Scientist
Description: *This position requires you to be located in the US*Must be willing to work EST hours  The Data Science team at Signifyd builds the models that power our fraud detection engine. We make fraud prevention at scale possible. Our machine learning pipeline keeps us one step ahead of fraudsters and their constantly evolving tactics and our research and experiments develop into new products that improve the merchant payments experience. We expect our data scientists to be hands-on. We carry solutions from a brainstorm to experimentation and all the way to deployment. Some days you may spend doing research and designing experiments while others are spent using your analytical toolbox to surface insights into real-time fraud attacks. We’re a varied group with a diversity of strengths -- some team members came to us from academic backgrounds, others from engineering, some from big companies and some from small, but all of us are curious and collaborative. How you’ll have an impact:Building production machine learning models that identify fraudDesigning new algorithms that optimize all the key components of the Signifyd Commerce Protection PlatformWriting production and offline analytical code in Python and JavaResearching real-time emerging fraud patterns with the Risk Analysis teamWorking with distributed data pipelinesCommunicating complex ideas effectively to a variety of audiencesCollaborating with engineering teams to continuously strengthen our machine learning pipelineMentoring other members of the team Past experience you’ll need:An advanced degree (M.S. or Ph.D) in computer science, applied mathematics, or a comparable analytical fieldAt least 2-3 years of experience post M.S. requiredHands-on statistical analysis with a solid fundamental understandingDesigning experiments and collecting dataWriting code and reviewing others’ in a shared codebase, preferably in Python and JavaPractical SQL knowledgeFamiliarity with the Linux command lineMust be able to work EST hours Experience we love to see:Data analysis in a distributed environmentPassion for writing well-tested production-grade codeUsing visualizations to communicate analytical results to stakeholders outside your teamPrevious work in fraud, payments, or e-commerce

Title: Data Scientist
Description: As a Data Scientist at Wandera you will join our Data Science chapter and be given a focus area to work on. Within this area you will work closely with the existing Developers, Product team and Data Scientists to research cutting edge new features for the Wandera platform. Examples of this type of work include discovering how we can classify mobile applications using machine learning techniques or using new customer segmentation techniques to display within our analytics platform. Certain languages and tools are central to the work of the Data Science chapter including Python, Scala and Apache Spark and so ideally you will have previous experience in one or more of these areas. A working knowledge of Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence principles and Data Science outputs would also be advantageous. Our day to day tooling is pretty universal from the world of software development so knowledge of Bash, Atlassian, and command line tools is also very valuable here. Engineering at Wandera is characterised by enthusiastic bright individuals working in small empowered Agile teams. It is important for us that you are a self-starter, excited by engineering challenges at all levels and are passionate about continuously growing your skills and making a difference to the team. We want you to flourish in this role and will actively encourage your bringing of ideas and solutions to the team offering a different point of view when faced with code conundrums. Required qualifications: MSc in DS or similar with some work experience preferably.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: We are now looking for an Semantic Analyst or Data Scientist to join our high talented and multidisciplinary team working for international European institutions.   What do we offer?   You will be assigned to different projects, normally for well-known international European public institutions, where studies or analysis to be developed are linked to semantics and interoperability research.  You will enjoy working in an informal atmosphere with a young but highly skilled team of professionals and with well-known semantic experts that will help you grow in your knowledge career.  Do you like travelling around Europe? Although Barcelona will be your main location, this project offers you the opportunity to visit different countries and meet with colleagues and customers abroad.    Furthermore...   Paid official certifications in specific technologies. Free language courses. Company benefit plans (healthcare, meals, insurance, gym discounts and other perks). Participation in periodic semantics-related events and scientific conferences.   Mandatory knowledge and experience   Knowledge in semantic technologies (Semantic Web, Linked Open Data, NLP techniques…) Knowledge in interoperability standards (e.g. XML, XSD, XSL-T, RDF, OWL) Knowledge in data models and their end-to-end management (Taxonomy and Ontology development) Knowledge of at least one programming language (Java is preferable) High English level (at least, B2)  Academic requirements   Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or a related quantitative discipline.   Nice to have (from more to less importance):   Previous experience in semantic projects Knowledge in methodologies about information and knowledge management Knowledge in machine-learning or other AI technologies   At everis, we believe everyone is unique and different, this is why we bet for an inclusive culture that recognizes and values diversity. We work day after day to create an environment in which we can explore, live and enhance our own singularity.     #WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

Title: Data Scientist, Portugal
Description: CI&T is your end-to-end digital transformation partner. As a digital native, we bring a 25-year track record of accelerating business impact through complete and scalable digital solutions. With a global presence of more than 2,800 professionals in strategy, research, data science, design and engineering, we unlock top-line growth, improve customer experience and drive operational efficiency.  Data Scientist, Portugal  General Description  We are looking for scientists who are passionate for data and are eager to tackle big challenges using Data Science and Machine Learning. The main focus of this role is to solve non-trivial business problems in Fortune 500 companies. This person will mostly work with a mix of structured and unstructured, and use scientific methods and state-of-the-art techniques and tools to help our customers achieve their business objectives.  Responsibilities  Understand complex business problems and translate them into structured data problems.  Capture and explore complex data sets (structured and unstructured data).  Prototype Model of different complexity (business analysis, statistical models, machine learning) using modern data science tools (Notebooks, Clouds).  Design and implementation of machine learning models, metrics and application of feature engineering techniques applied to customers problems.  Support pre-sales in business opportunities and the engineering teams in the implementation of production-ready solutions involving machine learning.  Evaluate hypotheses and the impact of machine learning algorithms on key business metrics. Simulations and offline/online experimentation (via A/B tests) is part of the game.  Research and understand user behavior patterns, such as user engagement and segmentation, using machine learning models, to help test hypotheses.  Communicate findings effectively to an audience of engineers and executives.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Applied Math, Statistics, Physics or other related quantitative areas.  Advanced oral and written communication skills in English.  Ability to understand mathematical models and algorithms in research papers, and to implement them into running software for Proof-of-Concepts and projects.  Ability to explore big data without a specific problem defined, in order to come up with the right questions and provide interesting findings.  Ability to provide visibility of the progress of tasks to the team by means of small deliverables.  Proficient in computer languages like Python, R, Matlab, Bash scripting and SQL, making use of the best frameworks for machine learning pipelines, data visualization, manipulation and transforming, models training and evaluation, and models deployment.  Experience with common feature engineering techniques and machine learning algorithms for Supervised and Unsupervised Learning, like Regression, Classification, Clustering, Dimensionality Reduction, Association Rules, Ranking and Recommender Systems.  Business sense and consulting behaviour to identify and breakdown problems, define and evaluate hypothesis.  Think critically and act in a detail-oriented fashion while keeping the 'big picture' in mind.  Ability to provide creative and innovative approaches to problem solving.  Ability to work independently and within a collaborative team environment.  Desired Qualifications  Masters or PhD in Machine Learning / Data Mining / Statistics.  Experience with Bayesian and statistical methods.  Experience with Platforms for Big Data processing (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, BigQuery), Cloud Platforms and Data Viz tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, R-shiny, Bokeh, D3.js ).  Experience in agile methods, software engineering techniques (e.g. unit testing, refactoring, version control), design of solution architectures and software product development.  Workplace/Travel  You’ll work in our Lisbon office with occasional local and regional travel opportunities.  We can offer  Competitive Compensation And Benefits  Flexible hours and Home Office policy  Accelerated growth opportunities with a structured Career planGreat workplace experience  We are actively seeking to diversify our team and build an inclusive environment where everyone feels like they belong  CI&T is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Xperi invents, develops and delivers technologies that enable extraordinary experiences. We make entertainment more entertaining, and smart devices smarter.  From the home to the car to everywhere in between, managing content and connections in a way that is smart, immersive, and personal is precisely what Xperi’s technologies do.  Our inventions are foundational to the global entertainment ecosystem and our products and data improve every aspect of the digital entertainment experience, from choice to consumption.  At XPERI, we embrace your uniqueness. Bring your imagination and creativity to us and be a part of a technology company that brings sensory experiences to life: where you will unlock your true potential.  Are you a Data Scientist with Computer Vision and Audio Processing / Analysis background?   We need you to join our XPERI Office of the CTO to work on cutting edge Imaging and Audio technologies, employing Machine Learning and AI.  The successful candidate will be part of the ML Data team working closely with our R&D and testing teams, to design datasets, perform data analysis and visualization, develop tools and evaluate and test our advanced machine learning and AI imaging and audio technologies.  Location: Brasov, Romania  A Day In XPERI As a Data Scientist Work with R&D teams to design dataset specifications that are aligned with the product requirements for imaging and audio ML projects.Collaborate with the data acquisition team to ensure datasets specifications are followed and can be realistically implemented during dataset acquisition.Provide metrics, statistics and analysis tools to ensure that the produced datasets meet the requirements.Develop data processing and augmentation tools to support enhancing our datasets.Perform data analysis and visualization activities and implement data analysis tools to support the decision making in the development of ML algorithms.Perform evaluation and benchmarking for internal ML solutions against the state of the art to drive dataset and model improvements.Communicate and present data analysis findings and evaluation results to various stakeholders and decision makersGuide uniform approaches to metadata and annotation data formats, and data management systems.  Job Requirements BS or MSc Degree in Computer Science, mathematics or a relevant field5+ years of industry experience in data science, data analysis or ML research rolesSolid Python programming skills, and experience with version control systems (Git, SVN)Proven experience in data analysis and visualization for ML datasets and experiment resultsExperience sourcing or creating large data sets for machine learning training or testingExperience in Machine Learning and AI Development, using machine learning development tools (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Caffe)Expertise in imaging and audio data and metadata formats (text, CSV, JSON, XML)Strong analytical and troubleshooting skillsAbility to work effectively and independently, managing multiple priorities and meeting deliverable deadlinesSelf-motivated, showing initiative, thoroughness and superior attention to detailsExcellent communication skills in both spoken and written English and experience presenting findings to decision-makersAbility to work well in globally distributed teams  Additional Skills (would Be Added Advantage) Experience in project management and development methodologies such as Agile/Scrum/KanbanKnowledge of digital cameras or audio recording systemsAbility to communicate well complex technical information to different target audiencesExperience with cloud platformsFamiliar with state-of-the-art ML, the latest ML developments, neural network architectures, and training and optimization methodsKnowledge or experience in the creation of synthetic datasets
Industries: Software, Electrónica de consumo, Entretenimiento

Title: Applied Machine Learning Engineer/Data Scientist - Search
Description: We are seeking phenomenal Machine Learning engineers and scientists to lead our Search development efforts with our International eCommerce team. What You Will Do:  Lead the field in developing state of the art techniques in Machine Learning and Information RetrievalDesign and implement state of the art Machine Learning approachesWork as a tech lead and define the roadmap for yourself and co-workersDevelop end-to-end ownership of major customer facing technologiesImprove match accuracy of consumer search queriesDevelop data models based on new data insightsWrite highly efficient code to serve and a/b testing new models related to searchDesign, architect and iterate on data modelsIterate, challenge, and accelerate best practices in search You Are Ideal If You: Are a voracious thought-leader developing best practices in search relevance, ranking, recommendation systems, characterization, classification, etc.An expert in Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing or the information retrieval spaceHave a relevant technical degree (preferably advanced, in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, etc.)Have 7+ years production-level experience in a data roleHave 5+ years field experience in building and evaluating machine learning & deep learning modelsHave 5+ years field experience putting machine learning models into productionHave 4+ years field experience using opensource frameworks (e.g.: scikit learn, tensorflow, torch, etc.)Have 2+ years field experience designing recommenders for Ecommerce companiesAre experienced with big data toolsAre experience with cloud technologies such as GCP/AzureFluent in Python About Search @ International eCommerce: We serve the needs of the vast market of Walmart consumers globally by developing cutting edge technology to support an omnichannel experience. We develop robust search engines, mobile retail platforms and countless other solutions to enable a best-in-class experience for our customers. We help millions of customers every day find the right products. We are at the forefront of attacking one of the most complex problems of e-commerce. Whenever a user types in a query or browses through product categories on the web site, phone or the iPad, our service goes to work. We mine billions of search queries and tens of millions of products to find the most relevant products for our customers. Team members take end-end responsibility in analyzing large amounts of data, creating complex models, improving their accuracy and deploying these models to serve customers. As part of this team, you'll solve fascinating and impactful problems in machine learning, information retrieval, NLP or computer vision problems. The algorithms you develop will champion customers need to express their intent and our goal to understand their preferences, implicitly or explicitly across devices and modalities (voice, text, image etc.). You will develop and deploy machine learning models, to engage and converse with our customers and to understand their goals and expectations to enable them to make the right purchase decision. Your work will be visible to millions of customers and you will have a direct impact on the goals of the Fortune #1 enterprise. If you speak and think machine learning then we want to talk to you. Come join our team and be part of this exciting journey. About Walmart At Walmart, we help people save money so they can live better. This mission serves as the foundation for every decision we make, from responsible sourcing to sustainability—and everything in between. As a Walmart associate, you will play an integral role in shaping the future of retail, tech, merchandising, finance and hundreds of other industries—all while affecting the lives of millions of customers all over the world. Here, your work makes an impact every day. What are you waiting for?
Functions: Tecnología de la información, Ingeniería, Diseño
Industries: Software, Internet, Venta al por menor

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Responsibilities  Apply and develop machine learning techniques. Identify relevant data sources (based on internal and external data). Actively bring and promote new innovative ideas to develop and/or enhance company’s data/data science products/offerings. Analyze data for trends and patterns and interpret data with a clear business objective in mind. Take initiative to experiment with various technologies and tools with vision of creating innovative data-driven insights for the business. Implement mathematical/ML models and patterns into production by collaborating with software developers and data engineers.   Essential Requirements  Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical or quantitative discipline/field. 2+ years industry experience in Data Science, Data Analytics, Quantitative research or Applied mathematics or 4+ years academic research experience in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, or related discipline. Proficient in statistical tools/languages, such as R, Python, MATLAB… and ML methodology, techniques and algorithms. Excellent research skills and ability to learn new skills. Attention to detail and ability to consider tasks from multiple angles to produce robust analyses. Excellent cooperative skills and ability to work in a team environment/team player. Strong ability to work in an autonomous environment. Excellent organizational skills. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, in English and Serbian.  We are offering   Good compensation - Competitive € salary plus benefits package.  Development opportunities.  Challenging but also a friendly working environment.  And much, much more...

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Beijing, China LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers, and every day millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities and gain insights. Our global reach means we get to make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can. We’re much more than a digital resume - we transform lives through innovative products and technology. The Data Science team at LinkedIn works in close partnership with cross-functional partners (product managers, engineers, designers, etc) to identify opportunities to develop and enhance products and features that connect our Members with greater professional opportunity. We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our team in developing innovative new technologies, features and products that will help further our mission of connecting the world’s professionals. You will be responsible for informing strategy and decisions as well as building, measuring, understanding and improving products. Ultimately, you will develop data-driven product solutions that will add value to our customers and improve the professional lives of our members. This role will have particular focus on creating the best user experience for our members in China, so that they can reach global career opportunities through professional identity.   Searching for your dream job? At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in changing the way the world works.  Responsibilities: Extract and analyze LinkedIn data to derive actionable insights Formulate success metrics, socializing them and creating dashboards/reports to monitor them Design and analyze experiments to test new product ideas and convert the results into actionable product recommendations Work closely with product and engineering partners to determine tracking specs necessary to enable analytics of our products and features Enable others in the organization to utilize your work by developing scalable data solutions Develop models and data-driven solutions that add material lift to principal performance metrics  Basic Qualifications: BS/MS/Ph.D. degree in a quantitative discipline: statistics, applied mathematics, operations research, computer science, engineering, economics, etc. 2+ years experience in SQL, Pig, R, Python (or any other scripting language), Hadoop ecosystem 1+ year working experience in product analytics or marketing analytics, exposure to A/B testing  Preferred Qualifications: 2+ years of industry experience, ideally at a consumer web or internet based company, working with large amounts of data Ability to translate business objectives into quantitative questions Ability to communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences
Industries: Internet

Title: Data Scientist
Description: O que esperamos de você? Paixão por Data Science! <3 Conhecimentos em modelos de transcrição de áudio (Speech to Text) e modelos de machine learning para o desenvolvimento de um produto baseado em inteligência artificial, que fará a diferença na transformação digital da Mutant e seus parceiros. Ser uma pessoa colaborativa e que gosta de trabalhar em equipe!  Além disso, o que também seria legal você saber? Metodologias ágeis: Conhecimento em engenharia de dados (Spark, Python, Scala, Bash) e nuvens computacionais (Google, Azure ou AWS).  Veja alguns de nossos benefícios! Plano de Saúde: Plano Odontológico: Seguro de Vida: Vale Refeição: Vale Alimentação: Café da Manhã: Horário Flexível: Home Office: Sem Dress Code: Dextra Snacks: Espaço Fun: Gympass: Biblioteca: Bicicletário: Vestiário: Programa de Mentoria: Plano de carreira: Eventos constantes de compartilhamento de experiências e conhecimentos: Benefícios flexíveis. Para saber mais, fale com a gente!  A Dextra! Atualmente somos a melhor empresa de TI para se trabalhar no Brasil, de acordo com o ranking do Great Place To Work Brasil em 2019!  Somos especialistas em desenvolvimento de software sob medida dentro da unidade de Transformação Digital do Grupo Mutant. Iniciamos nossos desafios em 2002 e desde então estamos crescendo exponencialmente, presentes no ranking GPTW desde 2009, superando quase 2K de projetos entregues, somando a cultura ágil à rotina de centenas de clientes.  Estamos presentes em Campinas (SP), São Paulo (SP), Curitiba (PR), Ponta Grossa (PR), Florianópolis (SC) e Miami (EUA), mas também temos profissionais atuando 100% remotos.  Nosso time de mais de 800 pessoas apaixonadas por tecnologia e inovação, tem como objetivo criar um novo patamar em desenvolvimento de software para o mundo digital. Atuando na criação e desenvolvimento de produtos digitais, pioneiros na adoção de metodologias de gestão ágil, combinamos processos de design, UX, novas tecnologias e visão de negócio, desenvolvendo soluções que criam novas oportunidades para nossos clientes.  Cultura! A nossa cultura é um motivo de orgulho! Por isso é o nosso maior diferencial. Levamos em consideração o comprometimento com o cliente e com a equipe: A valorização da capacidade técnica, da produtividade e da inovação: A colaboração: A Confiança na capacidade das pessoas e Transparência nas relações.  Diversidade! Apoiamos pessoas independentemente de raça, cor, ancestralidade, religião, sexo, nacionalidade, orientação sexual, idade, cidadania, estado civil, deficiência, identidade de gênero, nível sócio econômico ou qualquer outra característica individual.  Carreira! Oferecemos todo o apoio para que as pessoas se desenvolvam pessoal e profissionalmente, através de plano de carreira, programa de mentoria, ambiente desafiador e oportunidades de aprendizados constantes.  Então, se você também valoriza tudo isso, curte tecnologias de ponta, muito aprendizado e gosta de novos desafios, aqui é o seu lugar! Isso é a Dextra!  Quer conhecer ainda mais? Confira nosso vídeo sobre o 'Jeito Dextra de ser!'
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software, Internet

Title: Data Scientist
Description: This must be one of the most exciting companies to work for in the entire Pretoria! They are looking for a Data Scientist to create various machine learning-based tools or processes within the company. You must be able to utilize your analytical, statistical, and programming skills to collect, analyze, and interpret large data sets You must be able to use this information to develop data-driven solutions to difficult business challenges. You must have a wide range of technical competencies including: statistics and machine learning, coding languages, databases and reporting technologies. You must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.  Responsibilities For Data Scientist Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.  Qualifications For Data Scientist Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development.Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.Experience working with and creating data architectures.Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and conceptsExcellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.We're looking for someone with 3-7 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, has a Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field.  #datascience #machinelearning #datascientist
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software, Servicios financieros

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Data scientists kiezen vaak bewust voor Eneco Marketing Intelligence en dat heeft een reden. Veel van hen zijn blij dat ze met hun talent kunnen bijdragen aan de energietransitie. Met de verantwoordelijkheid voor een base van 2 miljoen klanten kun je écht impact maken en Nederland helpen om te schakelen naar slimmer, schoner en duurzamer. Anderen zijn weer erg te spreken over de professionaliteit in het werken. We hebben state of the art tools waarmee jij modelleert en analyseert. Samen een topcombinatie.  Als team Marketing Intelligence hebben we een duidelijke visie waar we naar toe willen. Dit overtuigt ook teams binnen Eneco als Marketing en IT om met ons mee te werken. Data Driven Marketing. We make it happen. Briljant voor ons om mee te werken, goed voor de klant omdat die met onze uitkomsten een voor hem op maat gemaakte volgende stap in verduurzaming krijgt aangeboden. Er zijn dus heel veel redenen om als data scientist binnen het team Marketing Intelligence voor Eneco te willen werken. Wat ga je doen?Met inzichten uit data marketing kansen creëren voor Eneco De belangrijkste opdracht van jou en het Data Driven Marketing team (DDM) is om onze commerciële organisatie te overtuigen van fact based marketing. Dit doe je door een voortrekkersrol te pakken met het toepassen van de nieuwste analytische tooling en methoden. Het implementeren van een marketing automation platform voor alle business teams is hier een voorbeeld van. Dat we hiermee een waardevolle stap zetten naar Next Best Action marketing (NBA) hoeven we jou niet te vertellen. Voor jou als data scientist is hier een belangrijke rol weggelegd. Naast in het bouwen van de modellen die het NBA-algoritme gaan voeden, zijn CLTV (customer lifetime value) en het attributiemodel uitdagingen waar je als data scientist dagelijks je bijdrage aan kan leveren. In deze rol werk je samen met verschillende marketing collega's in diverse klantteams en bij IT. Daarbij hou je ook een scherp oog voor business vraagstukken. Omdat we duurzame klantrelaties hebben opgebouwd, weten we veel van onze klanten. Onze marketeers kunnen op jou vertrouwen als zij klantgedrag geanalyseerd willen hebben. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor:analyseren en duiden van klantgedrag.voorspellen van klantgedrag via geavanceerde modellen.fact-based onderbouwen van business beslissingen.signaleren en pro actief oppakken van business kansen.inzichtelijk rapporteren en presenteren van inzichten uit data. Wat breng je mee?Je kunt je nieuwe omgevingen en situaties snel eigen maken. Je hebt focus, lef en executiekracht. Hiermee weet je de beoogde doelstellingen te realiseren in een steeds sneller veranderende organisatie. Je kunt zelfstandig werken, hebt een proactieve werkhouding en bent in staat om ontwikkelingen op het gebied van data science toepasbaar te maken. Daarnaast is het volgende belangrijk:Je hebt een master afgerond met een zeer sterke kwantitatieve component.Je het 4-8 jaar werkervaring als data scientist in een commerciële omgeving.Je hebt ervaring met het werken met relationele databases en kunt deze benaderen met SQL.Je hebt ervaring met specifieke data science software zoals R en Python.Je hebt kennis van gangbare analyse methodes en kunt deze toepassen op gestructureerde en ongestructureerde data. Wij hebben je veel te bieden:Een bruto jaarsalaris van max € 67.700,- (jaarsalaris inclusief 8% vakantiegeld bij een fulltime jaarcontract), afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring.Een vrij te besteden flexbudget van ruim 14%: bijvoorbeeld voor het kopen van extra vrije dagen.OV vrij reizen abonnement (24/7 in heel Nederland).Ouderschapsverlof, goede pensioenregeling en doorgroeimogelijkheden.Goede communicatiemiddelen, zodat je effectief thuis kunt werken. Waar ga je werken?In een gedreven DDM-team met duidelijke opdracht!En die opdracht is onze commerciële organisatie meer data driven en fact based laten werken. Als Data Scientist maak je onderdeel uit van het expertiseteam Marketing Intelligence, bestaande uit in totaal 25 marketing analisten, digital analisten, data scientists en marktonderzoekers.  Werken bij Eneco betekent werken bij een duurzaam bedrijf, met een stevige ambitie en visie op de toekomst. In een prachtig modern gebouw, waarin wordt gewerkt volgens ‘het nieuwe werken’, op een locatie die uitstekend bereikbaar is: op 2 minuten loopafstand van metro en treinstation Rotterdam-Alexander. Interesse?Please note, it is important for this position that you have good command, both written and spoken, of the Dutch language. Solliciteren en starten bij Eneco kan prima, ook in coronatijd. Wil je hierover meer weten lees dan onze pagina werken bij Eneco in coronatijd: https://www.werkenbijeneco.nl/over-ons/eneco  Wil je meer weten over deze vacature? Sander Knol, de teamlead van het Data Driven Marketing team beantwoordt met plezier jouw vragen via 06 -38727839. Voor meer informatie over de sollicitatieprocedure bel je met onze Recruitment Assistent Roshni Bechan via 06-27573180 of via enecorecruitment@eneco.com Meteen solliciteren? Dat kan natuurlijk ook, via ons recruitmentsysteem. Klik op de onderstaande button en stuur je cv met motivatie. Je ontvangt zo spoedig mogelijk een reactie.
Functions: Análisis, Marketing, Tecnología de la información
Industries: Energía renovable y medio ambiente, Petróleo y energía

Title: Data Scientist
Description: DigitalPoint is working with one of the world's leading reinsurance companies with more than 11,000 employees at over 50 locations around the globe. Located across Germany and many other European countries, my client has substantial growth plans for the rest of 2020 which has created an urgent requirement based out of their Munich office. The business is seeking a Data Scientist with strong presentation, consulting and project management skills.  Key requirements: • University degree in data science, statistics, stochastics, information technology, oran equivalent area of studies: doctoral thesis or scientific publications related toadvanced analytics and/or machine learning is an advantage• Outstanding theoretical and practical understanding of modern data science,statistical modelling, and machine-learning techniques• Several years of professional experience as an analytics consultant, dealing withdifferent internal and especially external clients• Track record of successfully leading time-critical projects: proven ability to deliverresults quickly• Certified actuary is an advantage• Excellent knowledge of statistical programming (SAS, R, Python, etc.): otherprogramming skills (SQL, .net, Visual Basic, etc.) are an advantage • German C1 Language is a must-have This is a highly regarded opportunity to join one of the Worlds leading reinsurance companies... This is an urgent requirement, so please do not hesitate to get in touch with this opportunity. Number: 020 3045 1033 Email: chris.scott@digitalpoint.online Please visit our website for other live openings: https://www.digitalpoint.online/

Title: Data Scientist
Description: We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Scientist to join the Techmodal team. If you are inquisitive and want to solve clients’ complex data problems, then this could be the role for you.  We’re a consultancy and technology company based in the heart of Bristol. As one of the leading providers of data driven decision support within the Defence, Commercial and Public Sectors we offer specialist skills across supply chain, finance and personnel. We have grown over 30% each year for the last five years and our team of 120+ is still growing. Our people are the lifeblood of our business which is why we put so much energy into making sure every single person has the opportunity to tailor their career and succeed in the way they want to. Whilst we have a big business mentality, we have successfully maintained our small business culture, which means you’ll join a close-knit team of like-minded people to help support and progress you through your career with us. We aren’t looking for a specific skillset or qualification as we want to hear from candidates who have a range of experiences. If you thrive in developing complex data solutions, are comfortable with working independently and want to take your career to the next level, then we want to hear from you. The successful candidate will have: ·      A degree or equivalent practical experience in a relevant numerate discipline such as maths, physics, business, finance, economics, engineering, or similar.·      Must hold current Security Clearance and have Defence industry experience. ·      Experience of relational databases.·      Developed data solutions, from concept to delivery.·      Programming and data handling experience in R, Python or similar. Experience with some of the below would be preferable: ·      Working with Python application frameworks such as Django, Flask.·      Managing application with DevOps practices.·      Working with Agile project delivery methods. Travel Whilst we try to minimise travel whenever possible and promote remote working, our consultants do sometimes travel to various client sites across the UK. We will cover all expenses whilst you are away and make sure you are well looked after. Remote working during Covid-19 We are closely monitoring government guidelines during the pandemic to ensure the safety and wellbeing of our staff. At present most of our teams are working from home and only travelling to the office and client site when appropriate. All new starters joining the business will do so on a ‘temporary remote’ basis until it is safe to return to the office and our usual working practices. Rewards We have a shared work ethic to go above and beyond for our customers, but we also like to have fun and reward hard work. With our teams currently working remotely, we are doing everything we can to ensure staff wellbeing and to keep up our regular staff socials virtually.  Our selection of lifestyle benefits and perks are regularly reviewed to ensure that there is something to suit everyone: ·      Competitive Salary·      Performance related bonus scheme·      Contributory Pension·      25 Days Annual Leave + Bank Holidays·      Additional day off for your Birthday·      Opportunity to purchase up to 5 days additional days Annual leave·      Private Health Insurance·      Life Insurance paying 4 x salary·      Generous sick pay·      Enhanced Maternity, Paternity, Adoption & Shared Parental Leave·      Cycle to work scheme·      Regular staff socials·      Free daily fruit delivery in the office For any recruitment enquiries please email your CV and covering letter to recruitment@techmodal.com No agencies please.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Valuement Group is looking for a:                                      Data Scientist  to join the I.T Team in Milan We are looking for a passionate and experienced Data Scientist. He/she joins the international “Smart Data” team of 3 people, attached to the Head of Smart Data, and will work for projects for our customers in 8 countries.  Responsibilities: The main mission is to turn raw data from our customers into information, information into insight and insight to business value in order to carry out our consulting services. Strategic issue for the company, the candidate will value complex and various data, develop data analytics solutions and provide data knowledge support for our consultants. The main activities on which the candidate will work are: Locate and define new process improvement opportunitiesLead data analysis lifecycle : Understand raw data, convert, enrich, design and execute algorithms for final analysis.Identify patterns and trends in data setsReport the results back to our relevant members of the business in countrWork alongside our teams Local Business Services to understand business needsProvide data support four our consultants (documentation, training, support):Develop solutions with the team for automating and simplifying data analysis:Participate to new business services development (software solutions, data platform, etc.) In addition he/she will also participate to the group's projects (Software development, Big Data infrastructure, Business Services, etc.):  Requirements: Coming from an engineering school or equivalent in computer science or applied statistics, the ideal candidate has : 2 or 3 years of experience in the field of data analysis, data science.Ideally experienced in the sector of audit or retail. Technical skills:Expertise in data analysisDeep knowledge of at least one RDBMS (Microsoft SQL Server or  MySql, Oracle, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL (MongoDB)Master in SQL queries, particularly T-SQL language (querying, stored procedures, functions, etc)Knowledge of basic Machine Learning practices (supervised and unsupervised learning) with statistical backgroundExperience in development with languages R or PythonExperience with big data infrastructures (NoSQL DB, Apache Spark, Hadoop etc.) is considered a plus Soft skills: Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information Attention to detail and accuracy.Service and result oriented mind: Ability to manage simple projects (plan, do, follow)Ability to work on own initiative, to solve complex problem in order to reach with proactivity goals: Strong verbal and written communication skillsHigh level in English (written and oral):  Additional Requirements: Experience in retail / FMCGPricing analysis, basic knowledge on cathegory management, understanding of maket research and suveysKnowledge in execution of the pricing strategyOpen-minded, willingness to join a consulting team, problem-solving, analytic, passionate about retail industry, motivated to improve.  What we Offer:  International and challenging environment Independence, respect and trust as long as your agenda is aligned with ours.Great team, office, tools and culture.  If you are an enthuziastic professional, passionate about retail and focused on value-adding experiences, we are curious to meet you!     Personal data will be processed and stored exclusively for the purpose of this or future staff selections, guaranteeing the rights under art. 12 et seq. of the EU Reg. 679/2018.Candidates are invited to transmit only the data necessary to evaluate their professional profile and not to send sensitive data.Valuement Group srl informs that the processing of personal data will be provided through manual or/and IT tools.Personal Data of candidates will only be processed by Valuement Group HR department and will not be disclosed or transferred to third parties

Title: Data Scientist
Description: As a Data Scientist, you will be analyzing large data sets of behavioral data (web analytics, ecommerce transactions) and product attribute data and developing predictive models that provide insight into customer preferences. These predictive models form the backbone of our services.  Our products, powered by data science, are integrated into the largest fashion and apparel ecommerce stores in the US and Europe and provide shopping experiences that revolutionize online commerce.  Your work will directly impact our 50+ million users and ensure their happiness. If you are passionate about working with user behavior data, big and small, this is your opportunity.  Requirements  We are looking for smart people with good communication skills who are hungry to tackle interesting challenges. If the responsibilities are attractive to you and you are passionate about answering questions like how users behave, what inspires and influences them and how we can build better products based on this information, we would love to hear about you.  We are impressed, if you... Have a history of conducting quantitative analysesHave experience in R, Python or other languages used for statistical analysesHave dabbled with or perhaps have advanced knowledge of machine learning techniques or AIAre able to present complex analysis results to both technical and non-technical audiences  About Us  At Secret Sauce, we work with some of the largest apparel retailers in the world to transform how people shop for apparel & footwear online and in stores. We combine data from retailers with data we create using machine learning algorithms to power innovative and powerful merchandising technologies.  About  Here is what one of our colleagues had to say about Secret Sauce on Glassdoor  We pride ourselves on our friendly culture.  'A very laid-back, team focused and self-improvement focused atmosphere. The right amount of challenges and butt-kicking when you need it, but not so much that it grinds you down. A very agile and quick moving company culture, but also a constant focus on code quality. Small enough to have a real impact on the whole technical architecture.'  You'll be joining us at a time when our focus is to scale our services. Fit Predictor already serves well over 100 million users worldwide and we expect to scale the service 5-10x over the next couple of years. Due to our growth, we are in the process of expanding our engineering team as well as streamlining our processes.  Based in San Francisco with an engineering office in Budapest, Hungary, Secret Sauce Partners enables the world's largest ecommerce companies to provide the best shopping experiences online. Our products are branded and built into ecommerce web sites and are actively used by over 100 million users. We are well funded, fun, dynamic and growing fast. Join us!
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Software, Internet

Title: Data Scientist (Remote)
Description: At Veeva, we build enterprise cloud technology that powers the biggest names in the pharmaceutical, biotech, consumer goods, chemical & cosmetics industries. Our customers make vaccines, life-saving medicines, and life-enhancing products that make a difference in everyday lives. Our technology has transformed these industries: enabling them to get critical products and services to market faster. Our core values, Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed, guide us as we make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do.  The Role  As a Data Scientist for the Business Consulting team, you will work with Veeva engineers, consultants, and fellow data scientists to support analysis and analytical data deliverables.  Your role will be to generate and own the mathematical and behavioural models that will help drive the generation of impactful insights and suggestions for our clients. Our ideal candidate is multi-talented, with the capabilities to develop statistical, machine learning, and optimization models but they are also able to be client-facing, to understand the business needs of our clients (both within and outside of Veeva), and present complex statistical and machine learning models to the stakeholders.  This is a great opportunity for someone who is excited about using their deep Data Science expertise to help shape the Machine Learning offerings of Veeva business.  This is a remote position.  What You'll Do Develop advanced algorithms that solve problems of large dimensionality in a computationally efficient and statistically effective mannerDesign, develop and assess highly innovative models for clustering, anomaly detection, and moreBuild and run an analysis of models and algorithms in order to assess performance and identify the best algorithms to present to customersEnsure models and algorithms support our customers and help them drive towards more intelligent and effective engagement with their customersExecute statistical and data mining techniques (e.g. hypothesis testing, machine learning, and retrieval processes) on large data sets to identify trends and figuresWork closely with the data warehouse product team to ensure the architecture is effectively developed to support algorithms that are reproducible for many clients while being able to tailor said models for individual clients  Requirements M.S. or Ph.D. in Machine Learning, Applied Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or other quantitative disciplines. Ph.D. with at least 2 years of relevant industry experience, M.S. with 3 years of relevant industry experience.Advanced in-depth specialization and experience in data analysis techniques such as: classification, pattern recognition, clustering, feature analysis, deep learning (NLP), fuzzy matching, sentiment analysis, A/B testing, active/adaptive learningExpertise in using R or Python to manipulate large data sets and develop statistical models, with the ability to accurately determine cause and effect relationshipsGood SQL skillsIntellectual curiosity, along with excellent problem-solving and quantitative skills, including the ability to disaggregate issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions, even in situations with non-standard problemsExcellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to effectively explain complex problems and advocate technical solutions to other team members and clients  Nice to Have Experience with commercial aspects of the Life Sciences industryExperience working with Software as a Service and/or enterprise productsExperience with AWSHands-on experience building models with deep learning frameworks (Tensorflow or similar)  Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.  Veeva Systems is an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we are committed to fair and accessible employment practices. Veeva Systems welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

With a focus on actionable insights, the Data Science & Decisions expertise will drive strategic direction with deep analysis throughout HSBC, working with various business stakeholders. S/he is responsible to design, build and maintain data science models to drive precision marketing activities, management information, product analysis, campaigns evaluation and customer intelligence project related to the lending business. S/he is expected to drive development and implementation of integrated intelligence framework so that ongoing learning acquired from campaign and in-depth analysis are captured in a systematic, accessible and transparent manner.  Within the overall Bank and Group strategies and policies, the jobholder is also accountable for supporting the credit card acquisition, usage, loyalty and portfolio activities, working in conjunction with Marketing, Risk, Service and Sales management to maximize shareholder value through effective cross selling and up-selling. The jobholder also responsible for supporting credit risk management to balance profit and risk of the business.  Principal Responsibilities:  Running of profit/loss analysis on unsecured lending product to ensure revenue generationAnalyze and improve application funnel by collaborating with credit risk on underwriting criteriaEnhance pricing framework for revenue generationDesign data – science models for unsecured lending lifecycles including balance growth, account activation and usage, retention, and product upgrade strategiesTo supervise/manage the full cycle of campaign management process from pre-campaign planning, campaign execution and post-campaign tracking.To implement database marketing policy to ensure effective targeting, consistent contacts and optimised opportunities across different channels.To ensure smooth implementation of marketing campaign.Provide advices on selection criteria, testing mechanism, campaign execution/process.To evaluate success of campaigns and share learnings with business.Conduct in-depth analysis on key business risk/opportunities and develop business strategy with product/marketing or credit managers.Conduct regular credit card acquisition, usage and portfolio analysis to provide insights of customer needs for product development.Take full ownership of internal data mining/modeling process from model development, implementation and evaluation.Consult with business users on need for models and make modeling recommendations.Develops predictive models, performs data mining and decisions support activities as related to the Customer Base and Marketing initiatives.To promote the incremental value of integrating data mining techniques into marketing process by practical business case and experience Analytics ManagerProvide coaching to the team members to ensure they are equipped with both technical and business skills required to carry out their responsibility effectively. Title: Data Scientist
Description: The Data team at Ordergroove is looking to hire a Data Scientist to join our growing lineup. Our team impacts the lives of millions of consumers through Ordergroove's AI platform which powers the retail experience of some of world's largest brands. On this platform the data science team is creating the foundational infrastructure for a new collection of data and AI driven products to enable frictionless commerce. If you're interested in a crucial role designing and building insights that feed highly visible products, then this role might be for you.  What you will do:   Devise, research, test and develop new ways that use our data to build long lasting relationships for some of the biggest brands in the world, impacting the lives of millions of users.  Build and improve resilient and scalable models for both batch and real-time services. Evaluate and test the tradeoffs between competing machine learning models, methodologies and architectures. Work alongside awesome engineers in an agile environment, constantly striving to be more innovative and efficient.  About you:   You have an innate curiosity to find and explore business problems using data and understand best ways to extract real world value from your insights. You are self driven and prepared to work in a fast paced startup environment. You are passionate about leveraging the best of breed technology/methodologies and eager to learn new skills. You write professional level Python on a daily basis (R additionally a plus). You are skilled at writing and optimizing SQL (core application DBs use MySQL Google BigQuery). You have a degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, economics, or another quantitative field and 2+ years experience in a data science role.  Bonus points for:   Startup and SaaS experience strongly preferred Previous experience building models for subscription products Previous e-commerce experience a bonus You ideally have experience with Apache Airflow You understand at least one Python-based web framework (Django, Flask etc) You have hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform  If you don't meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above - that's okay, nobody's perfect! We encourage you to apply if you think this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day.  About Ordergroove:   Raised $40M from top notch investors Headquartered in the heart of NYC (with offices in Austin and Denver) Over 100 clients including The Honest Company, L'Oreal, Home Depot, Bed Bath & Beyond, Walmart, PetSmart, GNC and illy Meet some of the team you'll be working with: Rob O'Callaghan & Eugene Kozhukalo  We're a close-knit team of passionate engineers, marketers and innovators whose mission is to help our clients become an indispensable part of their customers' lives through Relationship Commerce. We've raised over $40M in venture capital and are planning to grow our team to 100 people this year!  Recently named one of the 2020 Best Companies to Work For in New York, our collaborative culture celebrates independent thinking and curiosity. We demand the best of ourselves and each other and never miss an opportunity to celebrate our success. Company events include hackathons, wine tours, summer BBQs, trips to baseball games and game nights.  We compete hard for the industry's best talent by offering great employee benefits including one of the most flexible PTO policies you'll find, highly competitive compensation and meaningful stock option grants. Our New York HQ is minutes from all of the major subways and boasts a 6,000 square foot private outdoor terrace overlooking beautiful downtown Manhattan.  When you join the Ordergroove team you'll be surrounded by smart, fun people working to transform the business of commerce! If you're ready for a high-impact role at a company creating groundbreaking solutions, we invite you to learn more and apply!  At Ordergroove we are committed to creating a welcoming and supportive environment for all people. We do not discriminate against anyone for any reason. We encourage people with different backgrounds and experiences to join our growing team.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: About Known  Known is a modern marketing company engineered for the unprecedented challenges and opportunities facing marketers today. Known pairs PhD data scientists with award-winning creatives, expert research teams and strategists. Known is anchored by two decades of groundbreaking market research and data science capabilities, which uniquely empower our marketing strategy and acclaimed creative groups, who produce some of the most innovative, cutting-edge creative work in culture. The result? Marketing that is predisposed to succeed and be persistently optimized, directly impacting clients' bottom lines. Our clients span the leading brands in finance, technology, media, CPG, real estate and many other categories. Known has over 200 employees in 6 US cities including Seattle, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Austin, Boston and New York. Our teams have won multiple Emmys, Clios, Effies, Cannes Lions Awards and ProMax Agency of the Year three times.  Known’s Media Science team uses advanced analytics, machine learning, statistics, and algorithms to plan and optimize advertising dollars. We partner with our clients to translate their business goals into meaningful metrics, and buy media across all channels to drive those target outcomes. We are looking for a Data Scientist to join the team and work alongside other data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers.  The Ideal Candidate Will Have   A Masters or PhD from a well-regarded college or university. STEM degrees are preferred.   3+ years of hands-on experience doing quantitative analysis, modeling, optimization and/or statistics. Experience utilizing Python (or similar language) and SQL.   Superb communication and presentation skills   A desire to work on advertising challenges that require flexibility in approach -- everything from on-the-fly analytics to statistics, big data, machine learning, and mathematical algorithms   An ability to translate business challenges into quantitative problems, and solve them by whatever means necessary, which may not always be strict machine learning   A willingness to learn foundational knowledge and skills rapidly   An ability to think strategically, analytically, and proactively about diverse business problems   A commitment to managing the quality & accuracy of analytics, ensuring high standards with your and others’ work   Experience in advertising or advertising technology is a plus   Experience multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment is a plus   Experience working directly with clients is a plus   Experience working on a tech team is a plus, with experience in cloud technologies, version control, etc.    Your Responsibilities Would Include   Driving performance for our media campaigns and amazing our clients   Day-to-day management of advertising spend you’re responsible for, including ideation on quantitative approaches for driving value, monitoring metrics, and troubleshooting issues   Developing new techniques (e.g., ML models, optimization algorithms, and automation) to optimize KPIs and improve Known IP   Building analyses, stories and slides for client reports   Interfacing directly with clients to communicate results   Productionalizing workflows and contributing your code to our Known repos   Operating existing software infrastructure to traffic, evaluate performance, and analyze media

Our employees are the key to our success!  The zooplus team currently consists of 500 interdisciplinary specialists and managers from more than 40 countries who work at 11 international sites in the Sales & Marketing, IT, Operations and Administration departments. with data Being familiar with core Machine Learning concepts and being able to code them  Being familiar with data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining,
