Title: Data Scientist
Description: Join us as a Data Scientist  We’ll look to you to identify and work with data sets from across the bank’s data estate to solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems and apply advanced analytical methodsParticipating in the data community, you’ll identify and deliver opportunities to support the bank’s strategic direction through the better use of dataIt's a chance to develop your skills and bring an innovative and passionate approach to data science to benefit our business  What you'll do  As a Data Scientist, you’ll be evaluating and improving business processes and products using scientific rigour and statistical methods. You’ll be supporting and collaborating with multidisciplinary teams of data engineers and analysts on a wide range of business problems, understanding customer interactions with the bank and how we manage credit risk.  You’ll also be:  Developing your knowledge of data structures and metrics, advocating for changes for product development where neededConducting analysis, including gathering data and specifying requirements in collaboration with business stakeholdersIteratively building and prototyping data analysis pipelines to provide insights that will ultimately lead to production deploymentWorking with other colleagues across our functions to make business recommendations and presenting your findings to stakeholdersIdentifying new methods, tools, techniques and opportunities to deliver business value by reducing costs, generating income or improving the customer experience through applying data science  The skills you'll need  To succeed in this role, you’ll need a solid foundation in Applied Maths, Statistics and Data Analysis or Modelling theory. We'll need you to be skilled in producing quality implementation of analytics and models in Python, as well as in writing scalable data analytics in Spark. You’ll also be able to demonstrate your experience with statistical software, database languages, big data technologies and cloud environments.  It will be ideal if you have experience interacting with AWS cloud services, and academic or industrial experience of solving problem with a data science approach. A good understanding of software development principles and good practices to ensure a high quality coding outcome will be an added advantage.  Additionally, you’ll bring:  Experience of working as part of a multidisciplinary teamThe ability to articulate and translate business questions and use statistical techniques to resolve data analysis problemsKnowledge of statistical data analysis such as linear models, multivariate analysis, stochastic models and sampling methodsExperience with machine learning on large datasets and in deploying machine learning models into a production environmentDomain experience or knowledge of banking and finance, which will be an added advantageExcellent written and verbal communication skills   If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or if you’re eligible under the Disability Confident Scheme please contact us and we’ll do everything we can to help.  Apply for this job

You will work with great people to automate and optimize our data-driven decisions as well as enable the company to tap into data for product decisions. We partner with people from strong technology companies and computer science institutes.  Millions of rides a month, billions of coordinates, more than 30 countries, and a product loved by the customers. These would be the topics you get to immerse yourself, improve and optimize with high-end data science technologies. Bolt is literally changing how millions of people move.  Let’s build the future of transportation together!  What You'll Be Doing  Technical leadership in creating, developing, and automating data systems and data-driven solutions for accelerating company growth, improving efficiencies, and product quality Continuously improving Bolt design standards and coding conventions related to data systems Initiate and collaborate across the organisation and enable Bolt to deliver improvements and optimisations based on data Evaluate roadmap and proactively plan and solve upcoming issues and technical challenges related to data. Ph.D. in Computer Science, statistics or related quantitative fields, or a Master's degree with equivalent industry experience Comfortable in shaping open-ended topics into actionable plans and getting things done Mathematical fluency   Benefits  Great compensation – motivational base pay and company stock options No corporate BS – we’re moving too fast for that Amazing personal growth experience at one of the fastest-growing startups in Europe Working with a motivated and talented international team, plus regular team events Flexible working hours – as long as you get the work done Monthly Bolt credit for rides Impactful work – you’ll have a rare opportunity to build a product literally used by millions of people across the world  Our team is made up of thinkers, innovators and go-getters shaping the way millions of people move around the globe. We value passionate and down-to-earth people who are driven to get things done and find creative solutions to problems. We recognize that our strength and success are directly linked to the talent and skills of our team members and a lean approach to our work. Our headquarters are situated in Tallinn, Estonia and we have offices in 30+ countries around the world.  Did we spark your interest? Get in touch and let’s talk!

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description: BTAS J ob  Posting  Job Title  Clearance Requirement:  Junior Data Scientist  TS/SCI  Work Location:  Position Type / Standard Work Hours  Langley Air Force Base, Hampton, VA  Full-time/40 hours per week/On-Site  Summary / Objective  Junior Data Scientist will support the Air Combat Command Cyber Defense Correlation Cell’s mission assurance objectives by providing relevant cyber incident and threat information to operational commanders and other cyber mission assurance entities . This is accomplished by providing analysis and correlation of incident and threat data for mission assurance stakeholders, facilitating incident response coordination for aligned Mission Defense Teams (MDTs), and supporting awareness of the cyber threat environment across the Defensive Cyber Operations (DCO) enterprise.  Primary Responsibilities  Develop research studies, analyses, and projects that affect the ACC CDCC ’s programs and policies  Provide analytical support to Mission Defense Teams ( MDTs ), the Cyber Defense Operations Center (CDOC) and other cyber mission assurance organizations . Perform analysis, develop and ve rify hypothese s, concepts, and proposals in technical and analytical areas using : Big Data platforms, algorithms and tools: advanced quantitative methods and techniques: and large data sets  Create, develop, and/or apply existing tools and techniques to conduct data analytics: gather, curate, analyze, and extract meaning from large, complex, diverse data s et s  Develop, test, and apply optimized algorithms and statistical models for discovering new threat intelligence data, minimizing false positives, and recommending courses of action for internal and external stakeholders  Apply data to develop and provide analytical support to all levels of management   Supervisory Responsibilities  This position does not have supervisory responsibilities  Travel  Very little – less than 10 %   Required Education And / Or Experience  Preferred: Active SEC+ or higher certification ( e.g. CCNA Security, CySA +, GICSP, GSEC, SSCP )  Preferred : IT or Cybersecurity Degree  Prefer red: experience with Big Data Platforms   Security Clearance  An active TS/SCI clearance or higher is required.  AAP / EEO Statement  BTAS is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  BTAS is an E-Verify program participant.  Other Duties  Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Departamento de defensa y del espacio exterior, Seguridad del ordenador y de las redes

Title: Data Scientist (ML)
Description: At seedtag our mission is to change how online advertising is done. Our technology joins some of the largest online websites with the world’s best known brands to create a new way of advertising that is more effective and provides a better user experience for hundreds of millions of users every day.  Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, today we proudly count over 130 employees in 8 countries. As we continue our fast paced growth, we are looking for the best data scientist to help us develop our technology and help us change the world of digital advertising together. Our team faces massive scalability challenges to be able to process millions of requests per minute with very strict timing requirements. Through the use of machine learning algorithms we analyse the content of every page and achieve human-like content understanding to provide the best possible ad contextualization in the industry.  As a member of the Data Science team you will contribute to all the ML efforts of the company. You will work on improving our contextualization technology, which analyzes and understands the content of every webpage to create a perfect match between the content and our ads. You will help us develop language-dependent knowledge and find training examples to further develop the quality of our system.  Your responsibilities you will work on improving our natural language processing systems, expanding it’s comprehension capabilities you will help us develop our brand safety technology, which analyzes articles to ensure that ads are always displayed in a positive context you will work on the optimization of our real-time price engine to maximize the profit for our publishers  About you you have at least 4 years of solid experience in data science and machine learning you have a degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, physics or another degree with a strong quantitative component you understand the theoretical functioning of the main algorithms in ML and you have experience applying these to real problems you have ample experience with one or more of these machine learning tools: Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, etc. you are a proactive person who likes the startup work culture  What we offer you a fun, dynamic and international work environment a competitive salary adjusted to your experience access to a flexible benefits plan (plan de retribución flexible) a Macbook Pro with an external screen a great work location in the heart of Madrid (Gran Via)and the possibility to work remotely the option to work from home/telework and real flexible working hours the option to follow company-paid English and/or Spanish courses weekly the chance to participate in many offsite activities and have lots of fun with your colleagues!   Interested?  Then apply through our Website
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Medios de comunicación en línea, Servicios y tecnologías de la información

Title: Data Scientist
Description: IN A DAY IN THE LIFE OF THE DATA SCIENTIST YOU’LL:   Have a Passion for Continuous Improvement  Understand the decision-making process, workflows, and business and information needs of business unit heads and service manager/owners Proactively mine data warehouses to identify trends and patterns and generates insights for business units and senior leadership Research and implement cutting-edge techniques and tools in machine learning/deep learning/artificial intelligence to make data analysis more efficient Determine requirements that will be used to train and evolve deep learning models and algorithms    See the Big Picture  Translate business needs into analytics/reporting requirements to support executive decisions and workflows with required information Perform large-scale experimentation to identify hidden relationships between variables in large datasets Develop frameworks and processes to analyze unstructured information collected through social media platforms i.e., wikis, blogs, instant messaging, etc. and traditional sources such as e-mail and SharePoint.   Be a Strong Communicator  Visualize information and develops engaging reports on the results of data analysis using data visualization tools Advise product teams on new products, features or updates through data-based recommendations Support user experience specialists and information architects to enhance information visualization through development of dashboards and user interfaces Distribute best practices to analytics and product teams and provides consultations for their data-based experimentations   WHAT KIND OF SKILLS SHOULD YOU HAVE?   The obvious qualities: Dedicated, Imaginative, Professional and…  Up-to-date knowledge of machine learning and data analytics tools and techniques Strong knowledge in predictive modeling methodology Experienced at leveraging both structured and unstructured data sources Willingness and ability to learn new technologies on the job Demonstrated ability to communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences Demonstrated ability to work with minimal supervision   You’ll Have Experience With The Following  Experience using statistics and machine learning to solve complex business problems Experience conducting statistical analysis with advanced statistical software, scripting languages, and packages Experience with big data analysis tools and techniques Experience building and deploying predictive models, web scrapping, and scalable data pipelines Experience with Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services is desirable   You Have Degrees, Credentials Or Certifications In  Master’s degree or PhD in computer science, statistics, economics, or related fields   DO YOU LIKE PERKS? SO DO WE!  In addition to a competitive salary, we offer an RRSP with company match, gym membership and several health and welfare plans including company paid Short-Term Disability and Basic Life. Casual dress (prepare your jeans game, because that’s what we wear on most days). Creative work environment. We always welcome innovative ideas to make our process better.
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Software, Artículos de consumo

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Job DescriptionpstrongMelodyVR | Data Scientist/strong/p pstrongAbout MelodyVR/strong /p pMelodyVR launched in 2018 with a simple mandate: not to replace the live music experience, but to harness the power of virtual reality to get people closer to the music they love./ppWe put fans on stage with their favorite artists, from sold-out stadium shows, to intimate studio performances. Our world-leading technology means the doors to live music are flung open: capacity restrictions for concerts are eliminated, people can attend otherwise sold-out shows, and the barriers (distance, age, cost, access) that might keep fans from experiencing their favourite musicians live are swept away. The result? Performers can reach more fans than ever before./p pMelodyVR is the only licensed VR music platform and has the worlds largest library of exclusive immersive and interactive music experiences from the likes of Post Malone, Lewis Capaldi, Mabel, Wiz Khalifa, Kelly Clarkson, KISS, Niall Horan, Katherine Jenkins, Fall Out Boy, The Chainsmokers and Imagine Dragons./ppstrongMission/strong/p pWe are looking for a music-minded Data Scientist to join our newly formed Data Team. As our first Data Scientist, you will provide analytical and machine learning solutions for all Data roadmap items. /p pYou will work alongside our Data Lead Asha and our yet to be hired Data Engineer to accelerate delivery of analytical and data science services so Melody becomes a strategically data-centric business./p pstrongThe key deliverables of this role in the first 3-6 months are:/strong /p ul liOwn the development and communication of data stories to key business stakeholders within the first three months./li liDesign and implement machine learning algorithms to serve our app users and customers across the organisation to SLAs./li liWork closely with data engineers, product managers and the business to understand analytics needs and contributed to delivery of three features within the first three months./li /ul pstrongWhat a Data Scientist does at MelodyVR/strong /p ul liBring a creative analytical approach to problem solving in different domains. /li liWork closely with data engineers, marketing and product teams to deliver insights and data services./li liDesign with flexibility to adapt to changing business priorities./li liCreate an inquisitive, data-centric culture around the business. /li /ul pstrongThe Interview Process/strong /p ol liIntroduction to MelodyVR with Jamie (30 minutes) /li liVideo call with Asha (Data Lead) and James (Head of Product) /li liTake Home Task - this will form part of the final stage (2-3 hours) /li liFinal Video Interview with extended team (1 hour 30 minutes)/li liFinal call with our COO /li /olpstrongDiversity Statement/strong/ppMelodyVR is an equal opportunities employer who welcomes applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, gender, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age. We strongly believe that diversity in the workplace is an asset both to our organisation and for our employees./ppstrongThis statement holds true across the globe, no matter which territory we are currently present or to enter in the future/strong/p
Industries: Software

Title: Data Scientist II
Description: Estamos buscando profissionais de Data Science com experiência em transformar grandes quantidades de dados em insights acionáveis e apaixonados por fazer descobertas que tenham alto impacto na satisfação dos nossos clientes e no resultado da empresa.  Trabalhando na área de Data Science, você terá a oportunidade de atuar em um time de cientistas de dados que atende todas as áreas da Cielo, gerando insights de negócio e apoiando a Cielo a se tornar uma empresa cada vez mais data-driven.  Buscamos pessoas motivadas que gostam de compartilhar seus conhecimentos e são incansáveis na busca de soluções criativas para qualquer tipo de desafio. Essas pessoas focam sempre no cliente, gerando recomendações, medindo resultados e aprendendo com eles em ciclos ágeis de iteração que integram  resultados rápidos e robustos.  Se você tem espírito inquisidor e não está satisfeito até descobrir a história que os dados contam, essa vaga é para você!  Responsabilidades e atribuições  O Dia-a-dia Vai Ser Fazendo o Seguinte Gerar actionable insights utilizando-se de técnicas avançadas de Analytics.Apoiar as áreas internas da Cielo com recomendações, focando inicialmente na área de Operações, responsável pelo atendimento dos nossos clientes.Negociação de prazos e entregas: com executivos e áreas parceiras.Montar e apresentar materiais para executivos, com mensagens impactantes.Ajudar na democratização de dados da Cielo, apoiaindo em treinamentos, avaliação de ferramentas, workshops, etc.  Requisitos e qualificações  O que você precisa ter de conhecimento pra essa vaga: Boa base matemática, estatística e conceitos gerais de programação/algoritmos:Conhecimento em banco de dados e linguagem SQL:Experiência com linguagens de programação. Exemplos: Python, R, Scala, SAS:Experiência com técnicas estatísticas e modelagem preditiva. Inclui experiência acadêmica!:Experiência de trabalho em áreas com alta carga analítica:Leitura fluente em inglês.  E Seria Legal Também Se Você Tivesse Pós-graduação, especialmente lato sensu:Ter realizado cursos no Coursera, Datacamp, Udacity, Udemy, Dataquest, Data Science academy entre outros:Experiência com ferramentas de Big Data (Spark, Hive, Impala):Experiência com ferramentas de visualização de dados (Tableau, QlikView, Microstrategy, PowerBI, DataStudio etc.):Ter publicações ou portfolio, participação em competições, ou participado em algum Hackathon com foco em dados.  Informações adicionais  A primeira etapa do processo seletivo terá a aplicação do teste Gmat e aplicação de um case.  Falando De Benefícios, Você Vai Poder Contar Com Pacote de benefícios atrativo:Remuneração variável anual (PPR):Horário flexível:Home Office:Sexta-feira curta.
Industries: Banca

Title: Medior Data Scientist
Description: Objective Partners is the creator of a smart marketing measurement platform that allows brands to track and optimize multi-channel media investments. Headquartered in Amsterdam, with offices in London and Singapore, our platform powers international clients’ data-driven marketing activities. Our clients are leading companies in telecommunications, energy, finance, fashion and retail. We offer a combination of software and consulting services to help advertisers optimize their media investments. As we are growing and expanding quickly, we are looking for a Medior Data Scientist - Marketing Analytics to join our team.  What will you be doing?First and foremost, you create value for our customers with your adviceOffering analytics consulting services to clients built on statistical analysis, forecasting, predictive modelling and optimization.Extending and creating marketing analytics models, which optimize media investments, analyze conversion rates and forecast churn and retention.Incorporating those models in smart actionable dashboards for clientsPlaying table tennis and/or table football (when it is safe to do so...) Requirements:At least 2 years of work experience in the fields of consulting and/or marketing analytics.Econometrics or related (math/statistics) backgroundExcellent analytic and problem-solving skillsStrong coding and analytical skills using Python, R and SQLExcellent communication and presentation skillsFluent in Dutch and EnglishTeam playerEnjoy thinking a few steps ahead to anticipate client needs and to help your clients to the next level in marketing and analytics What do we offer?You will work for large corporates, getting the unique opportunity to learn about the inner workings and business of not just one, but numerous companiesOur data scientists are also business consultants. This means you carry responsibility for your own clients from day one and will learn everything about the art of advising clientsObjective Partners is the frontrunner of marketing and media analytics in The Netherlands. We built some incredibly cool models (if we may say so ourselves) and you will get to work on developing these existing modelsNext to developing our current models, you have the opportunity to innovate and create new models for your clientsThe chance to work at a fast-growing companyThe opportunity to become responsible for a portfolio of clientsAwesome and regular team outings, sports, dinners and training Working at Objective PartnersAt Objective Partners, you will work together with smart, young, motivated and ambitious colleagues with great team spirit in a positive and encouraging environment. We have an open culture and are always prepared to help each other out. We offer the opportunity to learn quickly on the job, and a personal budget to drive your personal development.Interested? Send your application to recruitment@objectivepartners.com
Industries: Marketing y publicidad

Title: Associate Data Scientist
Description: We are Domosapiens- uniquely skilled, passionate data lovers anchored in a culture of connectivity. We are transforming the way business is managed by putting real-time data into the hands of every decision-maker across organizations. Diversity is valued here because homogenized teams create echo chambers: and nobody benefits from that. The insight garnered from diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and lived experiences results in pioneering innovations across the organization and better experiences for our customers. The more diverse our talent, the more impactful the Domosphere becomes.  Position Summary  Associate Data Scientists on Domo's Data Science Professional Services Team are client-facing experts who work with Domo's strategic clients on custom production data science use cases and associated business solutions. This role requires data scientists to understand and demonstrate competence in four knowledge domains: data engineering, model building, customer and initiative management, and problem-solving. These four domains apply to all aspects of building a production data science pipeline in Domo—including use case discovery, ROI estimation and tracking, data ingestion, data preparation and cleaning, feature engineering, modeling, training, and building out technical and end-user dashboards.  As a customer-facing data scientist, work time is balanced between calls and on-site interactions with Domo clients, with independent time allocated to building custom, production-ready data science solutions for clients. Furthermore, data scientists on this team are teachers and trainers, with a firm emphasis on evangelizing data science best practices and enabling customers to understand and own their Domo data science solutions. They also use and promote the data science suite of tools that are available in the Domo platform.  Associate Data Scientists are also contributors to Domo's Data Science Center of Excellence (COE). Through the COE, data scientists are encouraged to pursue innovative projects that enhance clients' user experience and move forward the vision of data science at Domo. This can include contributing to the building of Domo data science products, designing and architecting apps, writing knowledge base articles, developing sales and marketing solutions, or contributing to Domo-sponsored published works.  Key Responsibilities  Accurately scope data science initiatives and gather requirements from clients: Execute all phases of a client-facing production data science initiative: Successfully manage a portfolio of data science client projects: Teach and train customers on data science best practices and production data science solutions: Develop innovation initiatives that support and enhance the Domo product.   Job Requirements  University degree or equivalent industry experience with an emphasis in data science, statistics, behavior science, computer science, or related field: Strong R and/or Python skills (3+ years): Knowledge and demonstrated application of a breadth of statistical and data science approaches: Portfolio of at least one completed data science and/or statistics project, including visualizations, presentations, reports, etc. (such as a class project, etc.): Experience in any type of customer-facing role (1+ years): Strong written and verbal communication skills: Detail-oriented: Exceptional time management skills.  Domo is an equal opportunity employer.
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software, Internet

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Your role involves leveraging data, both currently available Big Data and various external data sources, to develop equity invesetment idea. You will aslo work closely with our fundamental equity research team to verify various investment ideas    Your role Work with complex and large global data sets Apply advanced analytical methods to solve difficult and non-routine invesetment problems Assist quantative resarch team in building machine learning models Gather data from multiple sources and vendors to extract investment insights Work closely with cross-function teams to achieve end-to-end data driven solutions   Qulaifications Bachelor/Master/Doctoral degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, operations research, bioinformatics, economics, computational biology, computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, and industrial engineering) Experience in working with Big Data and deriving analytical findings and insights for a variety of audiences is an advantage Must be proficient in one or more programming languages (Python, Java, Scala, C++, etc.) Experience in working with Big Data technologies (such as Hadoop and Spark) is definitely a plus Experience in working at hedge fund is a plus

Title: Data Scientist
Description: UNE® is a communication and recruitment full-service agency. With our expertise in the digital and communication fields built up over twenty years, UNE® agency holds with the idea that, to be relevant and obtain tangible results, you have to get to the heart of the matter and keep it simple ! YOUR FUTURE CHALLENGE Our client is an international company, recognized in the pharmaceutical industry and developing some innovative products & medical equipments. To support its development, we are looking for a Data Scientist to join their office in Switzerland.  YOUR MISSION & RESPONSIBILITIES As a Data Scientist, you will be in charge of the raw data analyses: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing.You will design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms. You will collaborate with the engineering division to bring analytical prototypes to production and generate actionable insights for business improvements.  Your missionAs Local Data Scientist you will report directly to the Digital & Data Scientist Lead and be responsible for driving the local execution and implementation of Data Science strategy and initiatives.The role includes responsibility for gathering and identifying local data science possibilities /initiatives /requests in collaboration with local team, IT, Engineering, Quality and global data science.This position also provides the local link between local and global data science, local functions, Quality, IT, Engineering in the respective Operational Business Unit.  Your responsibilitiesDrive the execution for local implementation of data science roadmap initiatives.Own, manage and lead local data science initiatives according to prioritization (e.g. Predictive Maintenance, Down Time Analysis, Yield Improvement etc.).Manage the respective functional and cross-functional interdependencies accordingly.Manage and drive local process monitoring and improvement in collaboration with global data science (e.g. descriptive statistics and visualisation, statistical process control, out-of-the-box-tools) and Operational Excellence team.Drive and execute reporting in collaboration with global data science (e.g. automated daily/monthly/annual).Organize necessary local trainings.  YOUR PROFILE Master in Engineering, Mathematics, IT, Economics or Physics with focus on Control Theory/Statistics/Mechatronics, Information/Operation.5+ years work experience in data analysis related position or equivalent academic experience/course record.Hands-on experience in applying and executing Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Big Data and Digital with various programming knowledge.Respective programming knowledge in Python/R/C is required. Further programming experience, a plus.Proficiency in database languages (SQL), understanding of data models and databases.Deep understanding of machine-learning, algorithms, clustering and classification techniques.Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL).Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau).Fluent in French and English.  If you think you have the right profile, send us now your application!

Title: Data Scientist
Location: 日本 東京都 港区
Description: ゆたかな世界を、実装する弊社は移り変わる時代において、常に、最先端テクノロジーを活用した事業創造をビジネスドメインとします。先人たちが築き上げた現代社会を前進させるためには、従来の限界に突破口を見出す必要があります。そのためにも、最先端テクノロジーの創出と、それを活用した新しい事業創造が必要だと考えています。 PaaS事業で取り扱うABEJA Platformは、お客様がDXを実現するために必要な仕組みを全て整えた、既存プロセスを高度AI化するプラットフォームです。あらゆる産業のあらゆるプロセスにABEJA Platformを導入することが可能です。ABEJA Platformの導入によって、AIを活用したバリューチェーンの強化とサプライチェーンの省力化を同時に実現することが可能となります。 今後の展望ABEJAは『イノベーションで世界を変える』というビジョンを掲げています。これは、その時代の最先端のテクノロジーによるイノベーションで、世界を変えるという使命を表現した言葉です。今はAIを、将来は別のテクノロジーを中核に据え、新たなイノベーションを追求してきます。 採用背景コロナインパクトも徐々に緩和し、大手企業からの引き合いが回復しつつある中、機械学習を組み込んだ商用開発プロジェクトが増えています。 お客様にとってより価値の高いサービスを提供するために、コンサルタントやプロジェクトマネジャーと連携してソリューションをつくるデータサイエンティストを募集します。 ミッションクライアントがAIを活用するために、事業の課題と最先端の技術を理解した上で、適切なアルゴリズム・ソリューションを実装する。クライアントが抱えている課題に対して、データに基づいて実践的な解決方法を提示し、実現する。パートナーのバリューチェーンの変革するような大規模に使われるロジックを研究開発する。 仕事内容短期：クライアントの課題に対する適切な技術的解決策の提案数理モデリング（予測、最適化、統計モデルの設計等）論文や技術資料・文献にあたって技術調査をするアルゴリズム・ロジックの実装・精度性能評価ABEJA Platformへの運用ロジックの実装 中期：実装ロジックの汎用化、サービス化（SaaS化）開発した技術の公開（社内外の登壇・技術文章化） 開発環境言語：Python 3.x開発環境：Linux / Docker / AWS / GCP利用ライブラリ：numpy, scipy, sklearn, pandas, tensorflow, pytorch, keras, mxnet, statsmodels, fbprophet など自然言語処理ライブラリ：MeCab, Ginza, Sudachi, Spacy, Chasen, Juman, Gensim利用モデル例：CycleGAN, BERT, Random Forest, SVM, k-nn, space state model, LightGBM, word2vec, doc2vec など 必須要件機械学習またはデータ分析における基礎的な知識募集業務内容に関する1年以上の実務経験探索的データ解析の実務経験業務内容に関わる国際会議、ジャーナル論文、技術文献の調査能力自然言語処理（日本語）機械学習マーケティング技術（レコメンデーション、広告配信等）コンピュータービジョン（DL、画像処理系）英語による日常会話・チャットに抵抗がないこと  歓迎要件機械学習アプリケーションの運用経験Linux上でのアプリケーション運用経験自然言語処理を応用したアプリケーションの実装経験（レコメンデーションエンジン・文章要約エンジンなど）インフラ構築の経験(AWS,GCP, Dockerなど)開発環境構築のスキル(各種ソフトウェアインストール、設定等々)SQLの知識データベースを扱った経験(MySQL,Postgres,ORACLE,等々)GitHubへコードをコミット/ブログへの技術エントリアップした経験Kaggle への参加経験ヘルスケア領域での実務経験ビジネスレベルの英会話 参考情報ABEJAでの働き方：コロナを機にメンバーのフレキシブルな働き方を実現できるように、2020年9月より本社オフィスをコミュニティ型ワークスペース「WeWork（the ARGYLE aoyama内）」に移転いたしました。 「リアル」で集まる場として本社オフィスを活用しつつも、自身のライフスタイルに合わせて、在宅勤務や全国のWeWorkを併用して働くことが可能です。 「GWは働いてもOK」にした理由。 Title: Data Scientist
Description: Salary will be completely negotiable and dependent on relevant background and experience and will include company benefits/significant bonuses.   The client, a growing technology business with lots of opportunity to develop a career and based in central Manchester are seeking a Data Scientist to join their team at this exciting time of growth.   In This Role You Will   Purpose of the role:    apply ML techniques to solve various business problems  pull, process, analyse and visualise data  build and validate predictive models  communicate results of your findings  work closely with other team members on delivering projects   Essential Skills   Requirements & Experience    excellent knowledge of ML  demonstrable experience with forecasting and time series experience using Python and/or R experience using generic ML libraries (scikit-learn, etc) SQL knowledge and experience in writing SQL queries great communication skills  Desirable (none Essential) Skills   AWS experience  Databricks, SparkML  Deep Learning   This is a fantastic opportunity to join an already successful business as it continues to grow, and you can be a big part of that journey.

Title: Data Scientist (f/m/x)
Description: About Fraugster:  Fraugster is a payment security company with the goal of eliminating fraud and increasing our customers' profits. Over the last years we've invented an artificial intelligence technology that combines human-like accuracy with machine scalability. This ability lets us foresee fraudulent attacks before they actually happen and gives us a distinct competitive advantage over every other player in the payment security space.  We're already working with some of the most well-known payment and e-commerce companies in the world. Notable clients include companies like Ingenico, Worldline and others. Fraugster is backed by top tier investors and is currently managing billions of Euros for our clients.  Job Description:  We are building a new cross functional R&D team - data science, data engineering & engineering. This team will be building the best environment for our internal clients - analytics, finance, product etc. The team's projects are about implementing new technologies, building tools & processes to enable internal teams to make better decisions faster. The team structure will make it possible for cross-functional, side-by-side work, and allow a unique way to develop a wide understanding in the data world. Amongst the projects this team will be executing: simulation tools, data enrichment processes, developing an advanced data lake, network analysis, research tools & optimisation. We are looking for someone with the ability to pick up a complicated project and see it through.  In this role, the following domains will be the main focus:   Network analysis Clustering and classification algorithms Analysis process automation  Testing development work in these areas   Skills & Requirements:   Bachelor degree: Master degree in relevant fields is preferred. Title: Data Scientist
Description: Job Summary  Roivant is a global biopharma company improving health by rapidly delivering innovative medicines and technologies to patients. We do this by building Vants - nimble, independent, entrepreneurial companies focused on delivering results in quick and innovative ways.  Innovation is the core of our culture at Roivant, and data scientists help build the technology to accelerate this innovation. Data scientists partner with business stakeholders, product, engineering, and fellow data scientists to generate true business impact across the Roivant family of companies. The problems we are tackling are big, and data scientists play a crucial role in accelerating Roivant's goal of reducing the time and cost of drug development and commercialization.  At Roivant, the technology team has built tools to improve clinical trial recruitment, identify rare disease diagnoses, automate processes, and more. If you are interested in a role that uses your technical skill to reinvent biopharma business outcomes, you will be happy here.  What You'll Do Build solutions centralized around data: empower data-driven decision-making, shape and streamline operational processes, improve targeting and conversion, and predict outcomes. Leverage the data science toolkit, including languages like Python, R, and SQL, computing frameworks like Spark, and front-ends like React and Tableau. Work closely with stakeholders to build and iterate on solutions and analyses to accelerate business impact. Collaborate closely and communicate clearly with technical and non-technical stakeholders to transform vague ideas into verified solutions.   Who You Are You want to create impact with your work and see data science as a tool to drive business outcomes. You have demonstrated success working cross-functionally and collaborating with engineering, product, and commercial teams. You have strong foundation in statistical reasoning and demonstrated ability in machine learning modeling and programming. You are comfortable acting autonomously in ambiguous or fluid environments. You have 2+ years of applicable experience or an advanced degree in a quantitative field like statistics, neuroscience, physics, or medicine. You are strong technically: you can access data with SQL and REST APIs, script with Python, and have demonstrated ability with an ML toolkit built on Python or R. Experience with healthcare data and processes, including pharmacy claims, pharmaceutical development and clinical trials, and insurance coverage is highly preferred.  Roivant is an equal opportunity employer. The Company prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants, without regard to race: color: religion: sex: gender identity or expression: pregnancy, a childbirth, or a related medical condition: reproductive health decisions: national origin: age: disability: genetic information: veteran status: an employee's needs as a victim of domestic violence, sex offenses, or stalking: credit history: or, any other classification protected by federal, state and local laws.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Data Scientist   Entia Ltd, Highbury, London, UK  Permanent, Full Time  We're looking for a Data Scientist to join Entia's Technical team. You'll develop algorithms to optimise the performance of our home monitoring solutions. You'll work with both real and artificial data sets, to improve clinical decision making based on data provided by our devices. You'll work alongside lively and enthusiastic designers, engineers, product managers, and researchers, as we prototype, tinker, build, test and ultimately launch our products. Ultimately, you'll be helping to create products that improve the lives of millions of people.  Entia is a collection of multidisciplinary experts with a passion for improving the lives of people living with health conditions. With our products, we allow people to enjoy their lives with family and friends: free from the stress of constant hospital appointments and safe in the knowledge that their health is being monitored. Our home solutions are created from the ground-up with the user at the heart of the development process, and in partnership with healthcare services around the world. Entia is backed by some of the UK's leading investors and is linked with many top healthcare providers. We have unique, award-winning technology and designs and are targeting major global healthcare markets.  What You'll Do  Develop new analytical processes and algorithms to improve the clinical performance of our home monitoring systems  Work with our engineering, clinical, and business development teams, to create optimised solutions for healthcare providers and patients.  Help to maintain and cultivate the Entia's positive culture   You Have  A strong statistics background  Experience with image processing problems  Experience modelling multivariate problems (e.g. Monte Carlo models) Experience in developing algorithms based on data analysis  Python programming skills (e.g. data manipulation and analysis) Prior experience of developing commercial software   Ideally, You'll Also Have Experience in medical products  Experience of having worked in a start-up environment  Been educated to bachelours degree level, or higher (or have equivalent experience), in a mathematics or statistics related field   You Are  Resourceful and have a proactive, hands-on approach to problem-solving  A team player, and are happy to collaborate with others  Able to communicate complex ideas to team members from a variety of backgrounds (technical, commercial, clinical) Someone with a good level of attention to detail  Have excellent communication skills  Have a willingness to improve yourself, and actively seek out feedback and suggestions  A genuine believer in diversity, fairness, and inclusion   What We Can Offer  The opportunity to join a rapidly growing company at the forefront of a new healthcare sector  The chance to be involved in the creation and improvement of systems, processes and culture with far-reaching impact  The ability to help shape the careers of talented engineers and developers, enabling them to reach their full potential  A flexible and fun work environment filled with passionate and extremely capable people  Regular company events, including team building events, social activities, and trips
Industries: Servicios médicos, Software, Atención sanitaria y hospitalaria

Title: Data Scientist
Description: About Shogun  Shogun is a B2B2C fintech company that helps home improvement contractors grow their business by offering competitive financing options to their customers. Our SaaS platform -- Hearth (www.gethearth.com) -- gives contractors an effective and competitive way to sell more jobs with financing as well as get paid quickly with a new invoicing tool. Backed by 8VC, Founders Fund, and other prominent leaders in Silicon Valley, Shogun is the fastest growing company in the home improvement financing space. We’re always looking for smart, ambitious people to join our San Francisco and Austin offices. Build something amazing with us and join a rapidly growing company!  About This Role  Data is key to Shogun for informing product decisions, optimizing operations and guiding company strategy. This team member will partner with all departments to inform and track strategic initiatives with data. A combination of data management and business sense is expected for this role. As the first member of a new team, you will get to set standards and processes for data within the organization.  Job Responsibilities Leverage data to understand users and their product usage, developing insights that apply to product, marketing, and business strategy.Partner with executives, product managers, engineers, marketers, designers to translate data insights into smarter decisions and applications.Establish and manage KPIs that measure the health of the business, product performance, and customer experience quality.Build dashboards and reporting processes to monitor business and product trends.Develop frameworks, tools, and best practices to apply data insights towards business questions.Conduct analyses and build models that identify opportunities and drive growth.Analyze experiment data, communicate results, and drive decisions.Potential projects may include forecasting business performance, developing data personas, and modeling customer health.  Qualifications Undergraduate and/or graduate degree in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other quantitative field.Excellent SQL skills and some experience with either Python or RProven ability to wrangle large datasets, explore and utilize raw data feedsDemonstrated aptitude toward Data Storytelling and Root Cause Analysis using dataAbility to deliver on tight timelines and prioritize multiple tasks while maintaining quality and detail2+ years experience as a Data Scientist, or Data Analyst using advanced analytical methodsFamiliarity with hypothesis testing or modeling/regressionsAbility to work in a self-guided mannerExcellent communication and organization skills Location:  We are hiring for this position in our office in Austin, TX (currently remote).  More About Us  Shogun embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We consider employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Make banking a Fifth Third better®  We connect great people to great opportunities. Are you ready to take the next step? Discover a career in banking at Fifth Third Bank.  General Function  The Data Scientist will perform data analysis, statistical analysis, and develop algorithms and methodologies on structured and unstructured data for on-demand and software-embedded use. Manage key analyses to drive more profitable business decisions. Focus on providing value-added analysis and recommendations to support business growth.  Responsible and accountable for risk by openly exchanging ideas and opinions, elevating concerns, and personally following policies and procedures as defined. Accountable for always doing the right thing for customers and colleagues, and ensures that actions and behaviors drive a positive customer experience. While operating within the Bank's risk appetite, achieves results by consistently identifying, assessing, managing, monitoring, and reporting risks of all types.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities Build large and complex information sets: Integrates and extracts relevant information from large amounts of both structured and unstructured data (internal and external) to enable analytical solutions.Conducts advanced analytics leveraging predictive modeling, machine learning, simulation, optimization and other techniques to deliver insights or develop analytical solutions to achieve business objectives.Develop and manage and develop analyses and algorithms that generate actionable insights and programs to improve long-term revenue and relevance.Partner with key stakeholders to understand the underlying needs of the business and formulate, communicate and create buy-in for analytics approaches and solutions.Effective communicate and translate business strategy and goals into manageable problems with well-defined measurable objectives and outcomes.Transform formulated problems into implementations plans for experiments by developing data sources, applying/creating the appropriate methods, algorithms, and tools, as well as delivering statistically valid and reliable results.Ad hoc reporting and analytics to support requests from the Bank's various lines of business.Provides input into the creation of detailed project plans, work assignments, target dates and other aspects of assigned projects.  Minimum Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Required Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field. Advanced degrees preferred, but not required.Typically requires minimum of 4-5 years work experience.Database and analytical experience required.Excellent written and oral communications skills.Ability to effectively manage time.Independent and highly self-motivated.Ability to communicate effectively.Strong PC skills including Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint).Data ScientistLOCATION -- Cincinnati, Ohio 45263 Fifth Third Bank, National Association is proud to have an engaged and inclusive culture and to promote and ensure equal employment opportunity in all employment decisions regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, military status, veteran status or any other legally protected status.

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description: Most companies try to meet expectations, dunnhumby exists to defy them. Using big data, deep expertise and AI-driven platforms to decode the 21st century human experience – then redefine it in meaningful and surprising ways that put customers first. Across digital, mobile and retail. For brands like Tesco, Coca-Cola, Procter & Gamble and PepsiCo. We’re looking for an Applied Data Scientist who expects more from their career. It’s a chance to apply your expertise to distil complex problems into compelling insights using the best of data science and human creativity to deliver effective and impactful solutions for retail and consumer package goods industry.  You will be delivering insights to internal and external stakeholders, helping them put the customer at the center of every decision. Joining our advance data science team, you’ll investigate, develop, implement and deploy a range of solutions that lead to actions and measurable impact for our clients. Working alongside the best and brightest colleagues, you will be part of a team who challenging and rewriting the rules, not just following them.  What we expect from you: Bachelor’s degree or higher in a relevant analytic field Skilled with data science programming in Python and SQL Experience in Statistical Modeling and Machine Learning PowerPoint and Excel  Data Interpretation and Visualization Presentation skills Story telling with data   What you can expect from us We won’t just meet your expectations. We’ll defy them. So you’ll enjoy the comprehensive rewards package you’d expect from a leading technology company. But also, a degree of personal flexibility you might not. Plus, thoughtful perks, like early finish Friday and your birthday off.  You’ll also benefit from an investment in cutting-edge technology that reflects our global ambition. But with a nimble, small-business feel that gives you the freedom to play, experiment and learn.  And we don’t just talk about diversity and inclusion. We live it every day – with thriving networks including dh Women’s Network, dh Proud, dh Parent’s & Career’s, dh One and dh Thrive as the living proof. Everyone’s invited.  Our approach to Flexible Working  At dunnhumby, we value and respect difference and are committed to building an inclusive culture by creating an environment where you can balance a successful career with your commitments and interests outside of work.  We believe that you will do your best at work if you have a work / life balance. Some roles lend themselves to flexible options more than others, so if this is important to you please raise this with your recruiter, as we are open to discussing agile working opportunities during the hiring process.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: We are looking for a passionate and professional Data Scientist to join our team to help us with our mission of helping us define and analyze the data across the company.Based in Singapore and reporting into the Director, Strategy & Analytics, the Data Scientist will work on team projects and individual projects. The right candidate will have day-to-day responsibility of ensuring accuracy of data for business decisions.However, we also recognize that each Data Scientist has a unique blend of skills. Whether your strength is in data modeling or in analytical, we want to talk to you. What You’ll DoYou will identify, undertake, and implement analytics projects including formulation of use cases, gathering of data, development, implementation and maintenance of models.You will be instrumental in supporting the development of Singapore Pools’ in-house analytic capabilities through the implementation of structured methodologies and creation of infrastructural capabilities to process and analyze data.You will work with strategy to identify opportunities to enable the implementation and realization of the long-term strategic vision of Singapore Pools. Who You AreYou will need to be a graduate or undergraduate degree in Mathematics, Statistics or Data Science.You will need to have relevant work experience though it is not necessary but would be an advantage.You will have working knowledge of Python/R, Pyspark, SQL and Big Data technologies.You should be proficient in various statistical methods used in data sciences.You should have the ability to communicate complex ideas to technical and non-technical audiences.You should be familiar with machine learning techniques in CNN and RNN. BenefitsCompetitive salariesFlexi BenefitsStaggered working hoursMedical InsuranceCorporate Mobile Plans Singapore Pools welcomes you not for how you look, where you come from, or differences you may have. We want you here for who you are. Diversity at the company helps us see a greater picture represented by different voices, helping us in contributing back to the society. So, feel free to express who you are, and be proud of your heritage and personal experience as you begin your journey with us! Singapore Pools was established by the Government on 23 May 1968 to provide safe and trusted betting to counter illegal gambling. As a not-for-profit organisation, all of Singapore Pools’ surplus is channeled to Tote Board to fund a wide range of causes in social service, community development, sports, the arts, education and health. Currently, Singapore Pools contributes about $2 billion annually to the Government in the form of taxes and duties, and for the funding of good causes.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Who We Are  Virgin Galactic www.VirginGalactic.com is on track to become the world’s first public commercial space line. It is dedicated to becoming a world leader in sub-orbital commercial space tourism with a longer term vision to develop other space technologies that have the potential to open space to significantly more people and users. If you are looking for a challenging opportunity that will ignite your passion for designing cool and innovative products, are exceptionally creative, are a great problem solver and can make things happen - apply today!  Who You Are  Virgin Galactic (VG) www.VirginGalactic.com is seeking a Data Scientist who will help shape the future of the Virgin Galactic workforce. The Data Scientist will lead the business intelligence effort, fostering data collection and management as a daily practice across the organization and harnessing that data to create predictive models that increase employee efficiency, empowerment, and satisfaction at every level. The ideal candidate for this position has a practical background in analytics, with experience in natural language processing, information retrieval, knowledge extraction, and machine learning.   Your Mission   Work with stakeholders across the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions  Mine and analyze data from internal and external data sources to develop analytical models that drive optimization of organizational structure, compensation, candidate evaluation, employee feedback, recruiting, and other initiatives  Implement statistical models and computational algorithms to inform the organization’s investments in personnel and process  Identify trends, patterns, and discrepancies in company data sources and synthesize into large datasets to support company and project goals  Lead the continuous improvement of data science and analytics by developing tools and processes to monitor ongoing model performance and analyze data accuracy  Coordinate with different functional teams and vendors to implement models and assess outcomes  Communicate insights to team leaders and business partners with crisp, accessible reports and visualizations that inform concrete business actions  The Employer retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position.  What You Bring   Minimum   Bachelor’s degree with STEM focus  2+ years related experience in technologies and practice related to analytics/insights  2+ years experience using Python and/or R to implement decision problem solutions  1+ years experience building and maintaining predictive and prescriptive models  Experience working with cross-functional teams and communicating across organizations at all levels  Proven ability to translate advanced analytical output to actionable insights for business partners and decision makers  Strong written and oral communication skills  Meet ITAR requirements as required for employment with Virgin Galactic   Preferred  Master’s degree in Data Science or Computer Science  Experience using leading data visualization tools to develop interactive graphics and dashboards for end-users (e.g. Tableau, Microsoft Power BI)  Experience building descriptive and inferential survey analytics solutions  Fluency in additional programming/ scripting languages (e.g. JavaScript)   ITAR Requirements  To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, applicant must be a U.S. citizen., lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by ITAR (22 CFR 120.15) or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Title: Data Scientist
Description: Understanding and engaging with customers is central to everything our clients business does. The way they gather, analyse and understand customer data will be critical to the launch and success of their propositions. They see the deployment of machine learning and advanced analytics as a key part of their development process, from generating ideas and identifying opportunities to modelling results. Due to growth they are now looking for a talented Data Scientist to join their team and you will be involved in the following: Data Strategy:You will understand our strategic plans (data and business and product level) and create meaningful data sets for modelling and analysis. You will source and access data from within the group as well as external. You will define analytics around customer behaviours (and help prioritise customer groups) through their engagement/lifecycle and use this insight to improve the likelihood of our success. Tool Creation and Deployment: Working with business leads you will understand their campaign objectives and work with them to source, select, and access the best data to achieve their business aims. You will make data available in formats, timings, and quality that accelerates the success of the business campaigns. Problem Solving: Working with business leads you will understand our objectives and use a range of advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to inform and influence development and deployment plans. You will deploy accessible visual aids (dashboards etc.) to enable us to track performance. You will work with test groups to test and prove assumptions on customer behaviours. Engagement & Presentation:You will actively keep abreast of new trends and developments in technology and data science. You will promote the use of data and data science as a key part of our strategic development. You will present insight and learnings in an accessible but compelling way to enable our business leads to make well-informed decisions. Business PartneringYou will effectively communicate the status, value, and importance of data to partner with business leaders as an SME. You will engage with relevant teams in the Group (Data and Analytics community) to drive collaboration and development of Data Science across the business. Where appropriate you will work with other companies to develop bespoke solutions or new capabilities. About You:You are curious and analytical, and someone who enjoys understanding the complexities of a market or how a business works. You can disseminate complex data and make this interesting and engaging to others. Knowledge and Abilities:Deep understanding and interest in data and how this can be deployed to drive adoption and growth of new propositionsCommercial experience using supervised learning techniques such as decision trees, GLMs, random forests or gradient boosted ensemblesFamiliar with data storage technologies and management tools - big data solutionsProficient in relevant tools such as R, Python, SparkML, SAS, etc.Adept in the extraction of both structured and unstructured data from multiple sourcesYou will have a good understanding of API technology and how this can leverage the practical use of data ExperienceMinimum of 2 years experience working in Data Science or associated field (ideally overseeing a small team)Minimum of a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Statistics, or another technical fieldExperience of using data insight to drive business decisions, growth, and innovationExperience of sourcing data sets through purchase and partnershipsExcellent communication and interpersonal skills with technical and non-technical audiences and a desire to work within a fast-paced, dynamic team environment Additional Information The Data Scientist will work closely with the Data Engineer and will report into the Chief Operating Officer of the business. This role offers a competitive salary of up to £60,000 + excellent benefits.
Industries: Seguros, Servicios financieros

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description: Description  Who are we? Watch to find out!  Koch Minerals & Trading is looking for a Data Scientist to join our Data Science Team in Houston, TX. The Data Science Team at KM&T partners with trading groups to find practical applications for machine learning and other specialized technologies that contribute to our profitability. The Data Scientist will be responsible for leveraging large, complex datasets to gain an objective view of commodities markets. They will evaluate and develop trading strategies based on their insights and inform the development of analytical systems that streamline the process of generating ideas. Further, they will experiment with new techniques and datasets to expand the capabilities of the Data Science team.  [CL1]  Working on the Data Science Team at KM&T provides individuals many opportunities to own multiple projects simultaneously in a dynamic and fast-paced global trading environment.  The Successful Candidate Must Have The Following Attributes  Expert on working with time series data within the commodities trading spaceSolid understanding of analytics and applied statistics[SN2]High sense of urgencyInterpersonal skills to work directly with traders and analystsExceptional oral and written communication skillsGreat team playerAbility to work independently and remain highly motivated and self-directed  A Day In The Life Typically Includes  Work closely with analysts, traders, developers, and other data scientists to develop powerful analysis, models, and analytical solutions Identify and collect relevant datasets along with Analysts and Developers  Design and upkeep explanatory data models Design and evaluate trading strategies Produce predictive models and maintain forecast datasets Promote a culture of experimentation that challenges conventional financial modelling    Basic Qualifications  What You Will Need:  2+ years’ experience working with financial time series and advanced statistics Expert analytical programming skills in Python Expert in visualization tools such as Tableau, Plotly, Power BI, etc. Expert in numpy, scipy, pandas, matplotlib, seaborn, scikit-learn, keras/TensorFlow, statsmodels Experience developing machine learning pipelines in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) Experience in designing experiments and conducting independent research[SN3] Master’s degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Financial Engineering, or related field from an accredited institution  What Will Put You Ahead?  Preferred Qualifications  5+ years experience in a commodities trading environment Experience with distributed computing, system design, and web development Experience with Scrum/Agile/Kanban Experience with source control Deep knowledge of AWS Exposure to NoSQL technologies    Want to learn more about Koch Minerals & Trading?  Koch Minerals & Trading, with offices in Houston, Geneva, London, Singapore, etc. is a global commodity trading company participating in nearly all commodity markets but focusing in petroleum and energy.  Salary And Benefits Commensurate With Experience.  We are an equal opportunity employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.  This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf  Follow us  [CL1]With the detail in the rest of the intro, I feel comfortable removing this.  [SN2]Solid understanding of analytics and applied statistics  [SN3]Added this point to emphasize that person can create new trading frameworks

Title: Data Scientist Researcher
Description: Verint is a leading global provider of security and intelligence data mining software. Our broad Intelligence-Powered Security product portfolio is deployed in over 100 countries, helping government, critical infrastructure and enterprise organizations to neutralize and prevent terror, crime and cyber threats.  Are you a top Data Scientist/Researcher?  We are expanding our research group and looking for top-notch talent to join us. This is a senior role, where you will be working on some of the most interesting and diverse data-driven challenges starting from Cyber security, Network communication to Speech and NLP. The group you will be joining forms part of the research and innovation team and has a direct impact on our next generation’s product portfolio.  So, If You Love Science And Technology, Are Not Afraid To Take Risks, Love Experimenting With New Ideas, Capable Of Delivering Under Uncertainty Then Come And Join Our Team, Where You Will  Have an opportunity to work with other top talents. Get to experiment with state-of-the-art data science and ML technologies, learn new methods and innovate new ideas.Work with unparalleled real-life data to crack problems within a wide scope.  Requirements  REQUIREMENTS MSc or Ph.D. degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Physics, Bioinformatics, etc.). At least 3 years of relevant experience and track record in Data Science and Machine learning.Proficient in Python (Pandas, Scipy, Scikit, etc.)/R/Matlab - with the core focus being on data crunching and algorithms development.Knowledge of network protocols, encryption algorithms, and Network Security is an advantage.Deep Learning experience on one or more platforms such as: Tensorflow, Theano, CNTK, PyTorch - an advantage.NLP knowledge and experience – an advantageTeam player and an excellent communicator, capable of abstracting complex solutions and presenting your work to internal partners as well as other researchers.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: All employees are working remotely due to Covid-19 and we have committed to not require a return to the office until September 2021 at the earliest. Many positions throughout the company will remain fully remote.*  Our Mission  To actively connect people to their next great opportunity.  Who We Are  ZipRecruiter is a leading online employment marketplace. Powered by AI-driven smart matching technology, the company actively connects millions of all-sized businesses and job seekers through innovative mobile, web, and email services, as well as partnerships with the best job boards on the web. ZipRecruiter has the #1 rated job search app on iOS & Android.  Summary Of Job  We use statistical science to understand how to construct an efficient and optimized market, understand causality, and drive our future investment. We use machine learning techniques to solve challenging problems so that we optimally match candidates and jobs. This includes NLP and deep learning along with pragmatic use of simpler machine learning approaches and heuristics.  We're looking for an experienced Data Scientist with a passion for problem-solving to join our team of data scientists and help solve new and existing challenges. Coming up with new analysis and understanding, building models, developing high quality, high-performance code and constantly improving the solution and expanding its scope.  Key Focuses   You'll be joining a team of software engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers working on interesting problems in the fields of recommendations, search, and NLP.   Develop production-level code that runs, trains, and maintains ML models.    Minimum Requirements   Master's degree or higher in Computer Science / Mathematics / Statistics or equivalent   3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist   Proficiency in Python   Strong background in machine learning, preferably in NLP related fields   Familiarity with Deep Learning   Experience with Linux environment and AWS Team player with excellent communication skills   Acting and thinking as an owner, building code that will run in production    As Part Of Our Team You’ll Enjoy   Competitive salary   Exceptional benefits package   Flexible Vacation & Paid Time Off   Employer-matched 401(k) plan    Privacy Notice Language   'For information about ZipRecruiter's processing of California job applicant personal data, please see our Privacy Notice at: https://www.ziprecruiter.com/careers/california-job-applicant-privacy-notice '   ZipRecruiter is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or genetics.
